text:
Pours an orange body with thick head. Faint fruity aroma with a sour touch. Very well balanced taste with a subtle sourness and a nice fruityness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12-05-17 // 375ml bottle. Pours a hazy orange beer, no head, white lacing. Farmyard, funky, green apples. Mild sweet with sour acidity, lemony, dry and tart. Mild carbonation. Great.

URUS 3.0
Aroma: pineapple, hay, leather, oak
Taste: medium sour, hay, leather, tannic, pineapple
Pite na URUSie. W zapachu lekka stajnia, może delikatnie daje po nosie, ale z charakterem. W smaku nie jest mega kwaśne, lekko szorstkie.

Bottle at t Brugs Beertje, Bruges. Slightly hazy golden with white head. The aroma has notes of funk, brett, farmhouse, sweat, roots and yeasts. Sour flavor with notes of brett, sweat, yeasts, bitter, lemon, citrus peels, dry. Medium-bodied. Excellent.
Very complex aroma, fizzling right on spot. Yellow / brownish color. Acidic but very cultural and balanced. Awesome.
Kapsel is drinking a Gueuze Girardin 1882 Black Label (2017) by Brouwerij Girardin. Dużo owoców, lekko kwaśne, lekkie nuty stajenne, mega rześkie i pijalne.

Bottle at t Brugs Beertje. Hazy orange with a huge creamy head. Aroma is funky, oak, citrus, Brett. Sour, flavors of lemon, green apples, vanilla, oak, a bit lactic. Light-bodied, dry and fizzy. Tasty Gueuze.
Misty bronze colour with a couple of bubbles on top. Aroma is wood and grape. Taste is crisp and dry white wine with a strong, tart backbone. High carbonation.

Bottle from Otters Tears, Burslem. Pours a clear deep golden colour with a foamy white head.
Aroma of wood, farmyard, white grapes, some green apple, slight lemon, a little blue cheese, a hint of vinegar and subtle fruits. Taste of lemon, green apple, wood, white grapes, sharp sourness, a touch of acidity, some vinegar, slight farmyard, a little straw, a hint of funk and subtle fruit. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation and a sparkling texture. A long, dry, sour fruitiness throughout. A high quality gueuze as expected and very complex. White grapes, woody and funky. Very enjoyable.
Very nice beer, however quite polite. Good balance, nice leather in aroma and taste.

@ Brussels, Belgium Beer Trip.


Clear golden color with a thin white head. Blue cheese cherry b.o. Hugh carbonation light mouthfeel. 


<><> Beeroda.hu - Beer Tasting Sessions @ Budapest, Hungary <><>
375ml bottle. Pours yellowy gold with a decent ,white head. Aroma is sour, lemony, sour. Taste is sour and dry. Toast, lemon, bile, stomach acid, champagne-like. Very nice. Bubbly.
Bottle 375 ml at La Fleur en Papier Doré. Pours cloudy golden with medium white head. Fruity, citrus, barnyard, funky, wood, quite sour. Light bodied.

A long-time favorite of mine amongst geuzes, but somehow never got around to rating it. Bottle @ In De Wildeman with bierkonijn, Ravi and the Oedipus crew. Hazy deep golden to copper color. Dense white head. with good retention. Aromas: wood, sour. Retronasal its sour, wood, light almondy. Flavor is sour with light bitterness. Light bodied. Moderate bitter and woody finish. Good as ever.
Aroma: stal en paard, muffig en toch zurig. De smaak is zeer rond en fruitig voor een geuze, maar deze wordt onmiddellijk gecounterd door een droog mondgevoel. Complexe afdronk.
Pours a murky moderately dark orange with a white lacing. Aroma is leather, vinegar, horseblanket. Moderately tart
Bottle. Hazy Gold. Tart, sour. Lemon/citrus. Fresh, sour green apples. Musty, funky. Crisp, dry. Very dry. Lovely. (2008)

Cloudy ( yeast residue not sticking to the bottom), amber, small head. Aroma tart, dry leaves, bread, a bit of yeast. Taste a very soft, pleasant tartness, fruity, perfectly balanced with some bitterness and a slight astringent mouthfeel. Aftertaste with hints of grapefruit. Bottom of bottle containing most of the yeast more fruity. Perfectly balanced to my taste: neither acidity bitterness or dryness dominating yet very tasty.
Bottle. Golden color with white head. Aroma has fruits, white berries, wood. Taste is fruity with long sour and dry aftertaste. Flavors of fruits, white berries, yeast and apple.
Bottle. Pours light hazy yellow. Aroma of apple, sour fruit and barnyard. Crisp sour taste, dry yet refreshing. Great.

Donker gele kleur met kleine witte schuimkraag. Het bier heeft een sterke geur die mij doet denken aan een paardenstal. Ook de geur van hooi komt sterk naar voren. In de smaak komt vooral graan naar boven. Het bier is heel sterk en scherp zuur. Op het einde is het bier heel droog.

Bottle at home. Lovely hazy golden body with almost soap like foam. Dont think soap just yet because this a really good oude geuze with aromas of apple, cask sour and some vanilla, as well as others I can not describe. This beer flows in softly, then attacks you behind the tongue just to slide away smoothly afterwards. Amazingly long aftertaste. Tasted with some moderate spicy food, more than good.
W aromacie głównie białe winogrona. W smaku przede wszystkim dzikość, również winogrona i cytrusy. Wytrawne i gładkie. Gueuze na wysokim poziomie.

[Bottle] Sour white grape and cranberry aroma, with faint sulfur and tons of stone fruit. Almost clear orange gold under a soda fizz that drops immediately. Skye
Sour stone fruit flavour with white grape and cranberry accents and a not insignificant bitterness. Medium light body medium high carbonation, mouth puckering.

Piwo lekko metne w kolorze pomaranczowo czerwonym z niezbyt obfita biala sredniopecherzykowa piana. W aromacie owoce cytrusowe i dzikosc ze stajni, czuc winogrona i ocet. W smaku raczej wytrawne i kwasne, sa zielone jakbla i taki smak "starosci". Bardzo gladkie z wysyceniem na dosc wysokim poziomie, smak bardzo szybko rozprzestrzenia sie w ustach bombardujac dzikimi kwasnymi owocami. Przepyszne!
2013 vintage. Na pewno czołówka najlepszych gueuze jakie piłem. Wytrawne, mega brettowe, z kwasowością idąca w stronę VAT-ów od Boon. Wyśmienite.

Tout dabord, il fut être amateur de gueuze (ce qui nest pas tout à fait mon cas) pour apprécier cette bière, elle nest pas vraiment facile daccès, et il faut quelques gorgées pour appréhender lacidité et lastringence, mais après cest que du bonheur comme dirait lautre (con). Donc robe blonde tirant vers lambrée, haute mousse blanche dune bonne tenue. Nez cidre, boisée, terre. Première bouche sur lacidité et le cidre, pomme verte, le raisin et le bois arrivent en seconde bouche pour un final équilibré. Superbe carbo, belle longueur, forte acidité, longueur interminable, corps léger. Bière excellente qui se mérite.

October 23, 2016. Bottle at home, 2016 vintage. 
Light hazy dark orange with a small frothy white head. Aroma is fruity and funky with a good amount of fresh green apples, lemon juice, some grape notes, hay, barnyard, leather and light spiciness. Taste is sour, funky and fruity. 
Finish is lingering sour apple cart, lemon, dry oak notes, leather, barnyard and a light peppery note. 
Medium bodied, quite oily mouthfeel, smooth carbonation. 
Great, fresh and quite fruit forward compared to older ones Ive tried.

Pours a hazy orange-amber color with a fluffy big head, which receeds to a thick, stable lacing, coating the beer easily the entire time. There is even a thick head on the rest of the beer remaining in the bottle.

Smells of a prominent funkiness, old mushrooms and lots of ripe blue cheese, with a pleasant mix of minerals and lime zest to balance the barnyard qualities. Lime and apple rind grow even more apparent, once the beer reaches room temperature making the fruitiness an ingedient just as prominent as the funk. 

Has a very soft, yet vivid mouthfeel with an awesome flavor development, starting crisp and light with a creamy, funky ending. Very well pronounced as for its sourness while leaving enough room on the palate for the fruit and effervescence to cut through, creating a pleasant complexity.


Tastes of stony minerals, a soft aqueous note, old bread crust, wet straw and a prominent funkiness. The funk consists of dried grass, creamy blue cheese and wet mushrooms, together with a note of flowers to sooth the funk profile. Has a bright, lemony and slightly effervescent mid palate, which results in a mushroomy dustiness and more creamy cheese.

An awesome beer, producing a mind blowing depth of funk, gently balanced by the fruity crispness. Does not have too many more layers to it other than that, but thos truly convince by their pungent ripeness. Maintains it light and refreshing mouthfeel though, ending clean and soft.

Bottle from last nights share. Pours out a hazy orange tone with a small soapy head. Sourness leads the aroma, dry woody elements, and some apple. Taste brings in more sourness, light and fizzy feel, as is right for the style. Finishes with a pucker.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2016 Mooi goudblond bier met parelende witte schuimkraag. Zurig aroma (witte wijn, azijn, beetje appeltjes). Heerlijk fris-zuur in de mond, lekker parelend en blijft goed plakken met een goeie droge warme afdronk. Appel, citroen, redelijk vineus, beetje hout. Goeie gueuze !!
Hazy orange liquid, average head. Average strength aroma of fruits. Medium body, little bit carbonation. Taste is sour.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy orange with a thin fading off white bubbly head. Aroma is of butterscotch, grapefruit, citrus, acidic, white grapes, musky, floral. Taste is of vinegar, citrus, acidic, green apple, white grapes, funky, slight chalkiness. Oily mouthfeel, dry finish, medium carbonation.

Bottle shared at Maakuns. Slightly hazy dark golden and no head. Grapes, grapefruit. Grapeskins, grapestones, nutmeg, almond, cobwebs, hay, grassiness. Light sweet, medium sour, light minerallike saltiness. Medium body, soft fizzy carbonation.

Drinking blind from a 37,5cl bottle.
In the aroma peaches, white wine.
The clear orange beer has a small off white head.
In the taste lemon.
Medium carbonated.

37.5cl bottle. Slightly hazy orange copper with a frothy white head. Funk, barnyard, green apples, citrus and wood in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium to light body. Taste is complex with sour, fruity and citrus notes. Overall, a very good beer.
Greyish hazy golden color with a large creamy white head. Notes of green apples, funk, sweet bread, and vinegar. Crazy good.

Aroma is very earthy, medium funk, a bit of spices, apple.
Light orange color, hazy, with nice, snow-white head.
Medium sourness, a touch of bitterness. 
Extremely drinkable.
Great one.

Slightly hazy golden color with off-white head. Aroma is really fresh and lemony with some light hay funk. Taste starts sour and lemony, quite dry and bitter on the finish with stonefruit pits flavor. Overall its a really good gueuze with a really decent price as well.

37 cl bottle from Beergium. Orangecoppery with white head. Lots of funk in the aroma, barn, citrus, lime, green apples. Zingy sourness, rather greenish of a kind. Nice body, a bit sticky in the mouth because of the sourness. Good but not as good as 3f, Cantillon, Tilquin etcetc. Its a bit of a different geuze to make that comparison tbh.

375ml bottle. Hazy orange with big head but it dissipates quickly into a thin layer. Very complex aroma of wood, treated wood, unripe fruits like grapes, apples and berries, lots of lemon zest, tart in the background, when warmed apple notes change into a ripe apple. Mouth feel is smooth and soft with decent carbonation. The flavor is complex as well. Dry to the bone with notes of wood and unripe fruits with medium strong acidity with notes of lemon juice. Overall a very good geuze. One of my favorite.
2013 bottle. Clear golden color with a thin white head. Blue cheese cherry b.o. Hugh carbonation light mouthfeel.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2017 tak porownawczo - dwie butelki, Girardin White i Black Label. Bez widocznych dat rozlewu, na korkach obu rok, przy czym na white label 2016 a na black label 2017 (sic! - o co biega? prosba o podpowiedz )Na obu piwach podobna, kiepskawa piana, nieco syczaca, na Black Label dluzej sie nieco utrzymujaca. Kolor samych lambikow rowniez wyraznie inny - White Label jest nieco ciemniejszy i bardziej przejrzystyAromaty - ku mojemu zaskoczeniu - to juz ZUPELNIE inna bajka... o ile Black Label pachnie jak lambik, o tyle biala wersja... jak blend lambika z czyms innym ;) W bialym sa bardzo ewidentne nuty miodowe i kwiatowe, dajace wrecz slodkie wrazenie. Jest tez oczywiscie nieco dzikosci, nieco stajni, nieco skory... ale stonowane to takie wszystko. juz zupelnie w tle owocowosc (cytrusowo winogronowa). Za to w wersji czarnej stajnia, skora sa ewidentna dominanta. na to nakladaja sie cytrusy (zest cytrynowy?) i jakies ziemiste nuty... w tle nawet jakies przyprawy. Duzo bardziej zlozony jest czarny i tyle.W ustach tez kolosalna roznica. Primo: bialy jest slodkawo-kwaskowaty. Czarny jest wytrawno kwasny. Secundo: w czarnym jest bez porownania wiecej tanin. Az do dretwienia ust. Czegos a la kiszonka tez w czarnym mozna sie doszukac ;) oraz winnych klimatow. jedna ceche maja wspolna: w ustach pasuja do aromatow swoich. Oba maja dosc dlugie posmaki, przy czym Czarny ma cierpkawo-kwasny zas bialy slodkawy wrecz (moze przez picie na zmiane, bo wszak to tez falszuje nieco odczucia) Nie ulega dla mnie watpliwosci, ze wersja Black Label jest bez porownania bardziej zlozona, szlachetna cy inse takietam slowa. Obie wersje sa smaczne, tylko, ze White Label truno traktowac jako typowego przedstawiciela lambikow. Ja wiem, ze nie byl dosladzany, ale ta wiedza niewiele zmienia ;) jest bardzo specyficzny, malo lambikowy.Black Label jest chyba najlepszym Gueuze jakie pilem w zyciu (duzo tego nie bylo, ale juz sie uzbieralo nascie). Wiec liczbowo to bedzie:White Label: 3.6Black Label: 4.0Aha, wrazenia potwierdzone przez plec piekna lubiaca lambiki a nie wkrecona w kraft - slychac okrzyki o dolewke czarnego zas bialego dostalem ze slowami "dokoncz sobie" :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).Rami Rami is drinking a Gueuze Girardin 1882 Black Label (2017) by Brouwerij Girardin at Grochów

Stosunkowo mocno owocowe, malo kwasne, lekko wiejskie, rzeskie. Szocik z drozdzy przyprawowy. Generqlnie: Do picia litrami, pod moj gust
375ml bottle. Pale orange with almost no head. Medium body with fizzy carbonation. Nice sour tones with subtle fruity sweetness. Tart, green apples, oak, peach, citrus and grapes. Very smooth.

Bottle pour at Chucks, courtesy of beastie. Fitting to grab a beer like this to close out our days of going out in Seattle and grabbing a beer. Memorable for sure. Hazy copper pour. Sour citrus aroma, and has a sweet peach to it. Amazing aroma to say the least. Excellent invitation. Tart, dusty, grainy citrus. Complete flavor. True grapefruit bitter and sour. Excellent.

Bottle shared thanks to JBPortland ! Pours a orange golden color with two finger of white gaseous foam. Lots of complex stonefruit, citrus and straight up cobweb basement funk. Great harmony of flavors with the musty fruit evolving from bright citrus to soft fuzzy peach all the while being wrapped in a funky dusty wet basement complexity. Dry on the finish and a real pleasure to drink !
Bottle. Pours mostly clear amber orange with no head. Nose and taste is sour grape, leather, apple. Very dry finish.

Never rated this & hadnt seen it on the shelves for a few years. 2014 375 ml. Red orange pour, low carb. Nose is lemon rind, caramel, slight must. Taste is lemon rind, sweet caramel, some leather. Lots of sweet caramel leading into tart lemon. Ive never had this aged and have never been a big fan of it fresh. I loved Bierpalieters though so I will definitely age the next bottle of this I come across.

Sample at En Öl- och Whiskymässa, 2016. Dark hazy orange, small quickly disappearing white head. Aroma is grapes, apple, funkiness, slight barn albeit not as brutal as many other. Taste is sour to tart, green apples, grapes, very dry finish with slight bitterness. Medium body, low carbo.

Flaska rose red cafe, brygge. Orange lätt grumlig kulör. Blommig och stallig doft. Citron och hö. Smak av trä, citron, jord, vinäger och halm. En ganska mogen geuze med viss sötma och diskret syra och torr avslutning.
Bottle. Pours hazy amber with a thin white head/lacing. Aromas of green tart apples, vinegar, yeast, funk, lemon, citrus. Taste is dry, sour, but not without sweetness. Really a crisp, tart taste.

Gylden klar skum 
Stald eddike læder citrus 
Sur modrate 
Tør livlig 
@f 1.

Very nice apple and barn aromas. Very accessible actually despite the significant sourness. Will developed, perhaps not the most woody or complex but I enjoyed it a lot. (375cl bottle from Dekoninck),

375ml bottle. Slughtly hazy amber body with a low white head. Barnyard, citrus, hay, wheat & fruit hits the nose. Similar flavor, followed by a distinct zesty finish. Gets more sweet & fruity as it warms up. High co2.

Hazy golden with strong white head.

Aroma: cheese, fruits, hay, barn.
Taste: moderate sourness, light swetness.
Flavour: white mould cheese, mature cheese, cider, hay, barn.

Very good.

Tasty and refreshig. Classy and tasty stuff.Unclear lovely golden color with a fine white head. Solid intensity in the aroma. Medium body and a pleasant carbonation. Mellow and fine acidity. Green apples, wood, citric and a bit funky.[Bottle from a trade with yngwie]

Pour: Dark orange, gold. Highly carbonated, high white foam.
Smell: Fresh, citrus, slight basement.
Initial taste: fresh ,light acid, tart; malty afternotes.
After airing - First: sour apple, citrus, tart; mids: dry mouthfeel; after: bitterness, lingers at the back of tounge.

Horse blanket, hay, barnyard, lemon in aroma. Pours orange with white head. Taste is nicely balanced, moderate sour, tart with funky, vinegar, citrus and acidic notes. Champagne-like carbonation and dry low bitter finish. Overall great gueuze.

75cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Very thin ring white head. Hazy golden pour. Tart aftertaste

37cl bottle. Hazy orange pour with a tall white head. Smells like sodium bicarbonate, sulphur, barnyard funk and apple cider. The taste is more balanced than the white label, with notes of apple cider, vinegar, salt, sodium bicarbonate and barnyard funk. High carbonation with a dry and bitter finish. This stuffs actually good!
Bottle. Mostly clear golden color with a medium sized frothy white head. Acidic aroma of apricot and apple. Acidic, sour and dry taste. Medium thin body.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

2014 A: Clear golden coloured with a huge white head. N: Green apples, pear, citrus, salami, hint of some smokiness, grapefruit T: Follows nose very well! O: Its really nice but could use some more years in the cellar.

Bottle shared by martjoobolut, thanks! Poured hayish orange with white head. On the nose its sugary sweet and apple cidery, acidic fruity, tastes of apple cider and stone fruit sweetness, finishing in strong apple seed bitterness, and almost lime juice acidity. Dry and dusty, yet extremely crisp on the palate. Stickiness restrained. Would love this paired with the unfiltered one. Probably perfect in summer at some garden party. Wouldnt dare drink more than 1 small bottle though, I dont have guts of steel unfortunately.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is funky and sour, barnyard, dusty, dry, straw, really good. Appearance is amber golden, off white head, somewhat hazy. Taste is funky, grape skins, tart, barnyard, almost wine-like in its tannins. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, grape skins and tannins aftertaste. Overall, this one is real good.

375 mL bottle shared by ebone1988. The pour is a darker golden orange color with a thin white film of head that falls to a bubbly collar leaving a couple spots of lace. The aroma is very funky and sour. Theres a nice balance of barnyard and fruit skins. The bright fruit is nice for this being a standard gueuze. The flavor is definitely more dank and funky than I was expecting. The fruit skins are really nice there is a good dry sourness to go with the dusty barnyard. The finish is surprisingly juicy and not sour at all. The mouth feel is a little lacking. Its a bit syrupy and under carbonated with a lingeringly juicy fruit skin on the aftertaste. Its an interesting beer for sure, but just wasnt what I was looking for in a solid gueuze.

375ml (thanks martjoobolut). Clear amber golden color. Small size, white head, stays. Rubber, acidic, fruity, lemon, juicy in aroma. Fruity, peach, sugary, bit of yeast in taste. Acidic, fruity and milky in aftertaste. Sharp mouthfeel. Easy to drink. Nice one.

Golden yellow colour. Slight round of white froth. Citruses, vinegar, horseblanket, hay in the aroma. Sour, crisp beginning. Hints of vinegar, leather, wood in the middle. Apricoty notes in the end. Finish was more citrussy without the yeasty bottom. Bit more sweet and apricoty with the bottom. Sourness was not overwhelming. Rather well balanced. Refreshing gueuze.

Bottle. Pours dark golden with white head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is sour, funky, medicinal, funky. Flavor is sour, sweet, slightly bitter, acidic, funky, apples. Finish is dry and sour. Overall: very good.

Bottle by Mart. Hazy dark golden amber beer, small white head. Nose is apples, barnyard, fruit, sweet notes. Tastes crisp, smooth tartness, apple peel, apple seed, mild oranges, pithy notes. Dry finish, orange, apples, apple peel, hop notes. Very refreshing and crisp, nicely balanced.

L:
-pours a hazy golden-orange with a small to medium,quickly dissipating,foamy,white head
-medium to high carbonation visible
S:
lemon,peach,wheaty,funky barnyard,green apple,woody
T:
-lemon,oranges,green apple,wheaty,astringent
-medium sourness for the style
-finishes dry and (surprisingly) clean
F:
-medium carbonation
-light body
O:
Really good Geuze.

Bottle. Unclear golden-yellow or honey color with white, fine and elegant head. Pretty delicate aroma with wild nature: acid-fruit tones, slightly citrus, pear, a little hay from meadows, wet skin, oak. Taste: very complex, layered, sparkling acidity, lemon, pomelo and grapefruit, bitterness of oak, a bit sweetness of a ripe grapefruit, dry, great balance. True masterpiece.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2016 375ml bottle from trade with SlovakSniper. Thanks man. Drank this one as a sign of support to Belgium. Heart and thoughts going out to them on this sad day... Aroma: green apples, lemon, citrus, hay, a tad dusty. App: cloudy golden with medium white head and good retention and great lacing. Taste and palate: light body, light sweetness, moderate carbonation, light sweetness and lingering dry light bitter finish. Overall: good stuff. I find it way better than the white label. Also compared to other gueuze I find it way less dusty or barnyard. Different... And I like it. I think for someone starting drinking lambics, this one is a good starter since it?s easy to drink since it?s well balanced between the sweetness and the acidity. Nothing really stands out. Really well made.
Hazy amber liquid with white head. Aroma of cider vinegar. Taste is sour and bitter. light body

0,375l bottle, 2016 version. Light golden hay colour, medium carbonation, smells sour apples, little bit of funk, cinnamon. Taste citric, dry, medium sour, more herbal and lemony tartness. Very dry. Great gueuze as it is.

750ml bottle that poured a fantastically clear orange-gold into my tumbler with a dense head of foam that grips the sides of the glass and lingers for ages. This beauty gives off a scent of funk, a bit of skunkiness and an underlying lactic tartness. Light bodied and silky with a round carbonation. Wonderfully balanced flavor that on my first taste gave me cinnamon hearts but later on gives me lemon, lactic tartness, brief hints of cinnamon and funky earthiness. This is really really nice and became even better with a sushi roll that balanced out some of the acidity. Top quality.
Trübes Orange mit wenig Schaum. Malzig, fruchtig, Äpfel, etwas Holz, säuerlich, sehr spritzig.

Bottle @ mikkeller Aarhus. Aroma of tartness, funk, some fruit. Clear with white head, not lasting. Taste is moderate sour, light+ bitter, dry. Medium body, dry oily feel, light carb., sour dry finish.
One of the greats. Tart, sour, complex. Green apples, but not overly so. Crisp, full of flavour. Go-to geueze for me.

Aroma - is tart, some funk, barnyard, spice, and some woody notes.
Appearance - body is a clean amber, with a 2" white head.
Taste - slightly sweet, tart, and spiced funk. There is barnyard, sweat, and some woody notes. Dry pear on the back-end.
Palate - on the light side of medium, lively carbonation, and a dry slightly funky and woody finish.

Bottle, 37.5cL. @Le Trappiste, Brugge. A golden orange-yellow opaque beer ; many small bubbles ; big white foamy head ; good retention. Wood, acid, barnyard, "earth", herb, apple. Medium sour, light to medium sweet, dry refreshing. Light to medium body, thin texture, average to soft carbonation, sour woody dry refreshing finish. Overall, a delicious gueuze ; nice woody acid barnyard character ; nice soursweet balance which makes it really drinkable.

A clear peachy, golden amber body displays a few slowly climbing streamers of tiny bubbles reaching up to a short frothy tight white head which settles back to a solid ring with some cap coverage... Several small dots of lace slowly return to the ring on each sip

Refined and clean with strong balance, solid complexity, and medium intensity... Fleshy tropical fruit is wrapped in wood and mild funk stank with light acid and sourness (maybe a touch of skunkiness from the green bottle) leading to a creamy, almost marshmallow like note which works with the fruit components to conjure bubble gum... Underlying nuances of almond, flowers, honeydew, watermelon, strawberries, and hay rolling into orange and grapefruit on a nicely cohesive, smooth, medium body with restrained carbonation lending a smooth creamy coating offering light residuals of the previously mentioned components combining to offer a sense of white wine with mild acidity and dryness... Finishes a bit on the sweet side with a medium plus feel... Highly approachable

12.7 FL. OZ. cork and cage bottle with 2016 cork stamped with 02, served at 54º into Orrefors Taster Beer glass

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2016 37,5 cl. imbottigliata a dicembre 2014, aperta il 31 Gennaio 2016.
Color albicocca con riflessi dorati, velata dai lieviti, schiuma bianca non molto persistente.
Aroma acidulo e lattico, pepe, stallatico, pelle conciata, polvere, citrico, frumento, note legnose, note zuccherine.
Al palato sempre acidula e lattica, lieve pepe, limone, frumento, note legnose, coda amaricante che ricorda la susina acerba mista a crosta di pane ed amaro erbaceo, accompagnata da una nota acidula e zuccherina.
Retrolfatto acidulo che ricorda sempre la susina acerba misto ad erbaceo.
Corpo leggero, ben carbonata, buona bevibilità, lievemente astringente.

----- cl. DX 2016, imbottigliata a giugno 2015, aperta il 25 settembre 2016.
A naso risultano molto più evidenti le note fruttate: mela verde, pesca bianca, uva, ciliegia che più si scalda più risulta evidente; il tutto accompagnato da legno, aceto, stallatico, leggera polvere ed una nota davvero leggera che ricorda vagamente il Bostik.
Al palato stallatico, pompelmo, uva, leggera mela verde, legno, frumento; finale caratterizzato da legno, pompelmo, frumento e polvere.
Corpo medio, medio-pieno, ben carbonata.
Ambrato con riflessi dorati, velato dai lieviti, schiuma bianca che svanisce in pochissimo tempo.

0,375l bottle at home. Cork says Version 2015. orange hazy color, small white head. good lacing. smells sour, some funk, green apples, light berry notes, spices, marzipan, ice smell. medium body, very bubbly carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes sour, quite citric, light green apples, grass, herbal, a bit medical even, some funk, light nutty. finishes very dry with notes herbal / grasy notes and light notes of green apples. good one, a bit too dry and herbal / grassy for me, but still quite nice.

750ml bottle. Restobieres, Brussels. Cloudy, orange gold. No head, save for a bubble or two, rising from the bottom of the glass. Nose has a brown sugar sweetness. Some baked apple. Woody, damp and fusty. Some mouldy lemon. Pretty complex for a beer at 5%. Taste is dry, tart, and woody bitter. Cleansing palate. Some acidity. Finishes tart, and dry without losing the baked apple sweetness.
37,5 cl bottle, freshly brewed. Damp, funky, tart. Low sweetness, very sour. Somewhat leafy and bitter. I find some other gueuzes more balanced.

This is not a beer that I have any business rating because I think it sucks from start to finish. Out of the bottle poured a thick golden brew with little head. It stinks like a sweaty wino and taste like sour ka-ka. Glad I didnt buy pay money for it. Dont like sour beers in general.
Bottle. Golden orange with thin head. Smells at first like a really robust classic german lager, then had some grapiness, tartness, and rubberiness. Nice funky tartness.

Bottle from boxbeers. dk (2015). Pours hazy golden amber with an off-white head. lasting. Aroma of lemon, sweat, the woodpile, apples. Forget the taste for a minute, the texture is just that good: alive, slippery, some creaminess, a little sharpness. Sour funky and quite woody. Some apricots, apples, grapes. Lemon in start... WOW!
golden, clear, average white foam, sour aroma, lightly bitter, medium sourness, average carbonation, light body, very nice dry taste
Hazy golden in the glass with lots of fizz but not really any head. Massively sour on the nose - plenty of vinegar. Excellently musty really makes you lick your lips! Sour, sour, sour magnifique!

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2017 Pours a short white head with some typical durian and bitter flavors. Hazy and Gold colored body. Long in mouth with balanced bitterness and notes of oak and smoke.
retasted 1,5 y later: sourness is better fused into a round balanced. score improved from 3.6 to 3.8 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A golden colour, a head is quite big and blond. Aroma has grapes and fruits, sourness, lether and earthyness. Taste is strongly sour, earthyness, fruitness of grapes. Some herbal notes in the end. Medium bodied, strong carbonation. Very refreshning, balanced and strongly sour. Very good.

375ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours hazy golden yellow with a quick fading white head. Aroma is sour, funky, green apples, lemon, leather, earthy and sour grapes. Flavour is tart and dry. Medium bodied, high carbonation. Finish is dry, woody, tart and well-balanced.

Hazy orange, stable white fluff. Sparkling carb. Acidic and acetic aroma with malt and fruity berries. Sour, acetic flavour with berries showing through and with lemon juice towards finish. Kind of juicy yet very dry. Some dusty and earthy notes in the aftertaste.
Bue en bouteille de 37,5cl. Grosse gueuze qui tâche comme je n'aime pas. Vie. Faite mais trop acide pour moi.
Very nice stuff. Grapefruit peel, sour orange and some pineapple. Hazy orange pour with some head. A hint of light camomile. Tangy finish. Bottle from julios liquors

Bottle
Aroma-barnyard, 
Appearance-amber, clear, white foam, 
Taste-heavily sour, medium sweetness, lightly bitter
Palate-medium body, sticky, lively, long finish, 
Overall-very good
From bottle. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of wood, tart, fuuuunk and barnyard. Taste is lots of funk, really sour, complex and wonderfully balanced. Worth way more than asking price.

Ambrée orangé. Forte effervescence. Très fruité. Beau corps. Agrume sûre. Boisé. Levure sauvage. Florale. Finale sèche et acidulé. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle, pours hazy orange with a white head. Barnyard funkyness, wood, apple, lemon, gooseberries, leather, light vinegar, red currant, more fruityness. Lovely
375ml bottle at Cambrinus, Bruges. Hazy golden, small white head. Great aroma, lemon, vinegar, yeast, cellar, hay, funk. Taste is similar, very rich, not too sour, light saltiness. Excellent one.
Bottle from Erzbierschof Zurich. Oh yes, the unfiltered one with the black label really is a lot better! Well balanced sourness, funk, crispness. Ah, what a beer...

375 ml from Amity Wine in New Haven. About as "heavy" as a 5.0% ABV beer can possibly be. Hardly any discernible malts or hops, but still loaded with flavor. Layers and layers of thick, sour, funk. This is seriously one of the best gueuzes out there.

[2015-10-16] Kullankeltainen, samea, luonnonvaalea vaahto. Tuoksu kirpeä, hapan ja hieman hiivainen. Maku on kirpeä ja erittäin hapan. Suutuntuma on voimakkaan hiilihappoinen, runko vahvuuteen nähden täyteläinen.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2015 opalescent dark golden colour, minimal off-white head; aroma of balsamic acid, oak, intensive fruitiness, and leather notes; taste is dominated by acidic sourness with woody notes, fruits and some tart; excellent gueuze
@ Basunen 15-9-23: Lätt syrlig doft och smak med tydliga toner av vindruvor. Mycket lätt men fräsch syrlighet.

(2001 375ml bottle shared @ Akkurat, Sept 19 2015) Pours a slightly hazed darkish orange with a big lingering white head and lace. Aroma is still surprisingly and wonderfully fruity, especially apple and white grape, some lemon peel, but now loads of wood, dry leaves, herbal, sweaty Brett, a touch of sweet maltiness. Some cellar type feel too. On the palate, a good balance of fruit, wood, dried hops and funk. Apple cider vinegar, grapes, some light lemony citrus touches, slightly sweet malt, loads of old wood planks, slight earth, old hops and herbal notes, a touch of cedar, really grabbing at the back of the mouth as you swallow. Funk is moderate to high, earthy and sweaty. Aftertaste is woody, astringent and medicinal with a tart core. Moderate body, nicely active but not terribly high carb. This bottle had aged beautifully, love the way the fruit persists to match the expected woody, herbal characters of an old bottle. Big flavours, but still pretty elegant as well.

Grumlig gyllenljus med bärnstens ton, svag krona & små bubblor, doft av äpplen, kompost, kvistar från äpple, tropisk doft, lite blommig, smak med makalös syra men ändå behaglig, viss äppelsötma, och vinös känsla & en viss syra härjar kvar på tungan tillsammans med bittra äppelstjärnor

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375 ml corked bottle, 2014 vintage, from Etre Gourmet.
Amber, moderately hazy body, with a small, fluffy, off-white head.
Aroma of funk, oak, sour citrus, apples, pears, grapes, earth, some young cheese.
Tastes of oak, funk, pears, green apples, citrus, pale grapes, cheese, vinegar, some fruity sweetness.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes sour, dry, but not too overpowering, fruity, wooden, with pears again, cheese.

Very tasty. Feels simple, while being complex at the same time, really well balanced. The sourness isnt too overpowering, drinks pretty smooth. Really lovely fruit notes, with the pears sticking out. One of the very best Lambics Ive had so far.

2015 bottle. Slightly hazy golden amber with an off-white head that lasts well. Aroma of lemon, sweat, the woodpile, apples. Forget the taste for a minute, the texture is just that good: alive, slippery, some creaminess, a little sharpness. Sour funky and quite woody. Some apricots, apples, grapes. Less lemony than it smelled at first. Gradually reveals more and more but still just slips down. Stunning.

Bottle. Birthday gift, thanks finol.
Clear, Amber, red. Thin white head.
Arom of old fruit, cellar. Floral citrus
Sour taste, vanilla notes, nice feel, some bitterness and sweetness. 
Grape fruit.
Nice feel. Could lose some of the bitterness.

16/07/2015 - 37,5cl bottle @Noorman, Anzegem
Clear orange, no head. Sour, fruity (apples, grapes, ..) pepper, dry. Very enjoyable. Untill now best gueuze I had.
big funky aroma of white grape/wine, lemon and light green olive. Flavor the same, just a bit mellower. Feel is thin but I like the pucker.
Pours a golden body with a white head. Has a lot of sour notes of grapes, yet a sweet balancing finish.

Quite an aroma bomb geuze. Complex fruitiness, some grapefruits, lemon, apples, mango, grapes, some wood backup. Mild tartness all the way, pleasantly balanced with moderate to light sweetness. Feels very fresh and refreshing. One of the best from this style I ever tried
Tate: grapefruit, white grapes, lemon sezt, apple. Aroma: Pleasant lamic and apple aroma, bit pear, wooden chips.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2015 0.375 l corked bottle from P&M Getränke, bottled in 2013 or 2014. Minimally hazy, golden orange with a thin, frothy, quickly diminishing, white head. Funky, sourish-fruity aroma of lemon, gooseberry, oak and pepper. Funky, sour-fruity taste of lemon, gooseberry, green apples, oak and pepper, followed by a long, tart and very peppery finish. Thin body, astringent and spritzy mouthfeel, flat. Extremely funky and complex, absolutely delicious. Massive lemony and sour taste. Awesome!

Bottle. Interestingly this pours darker than most Gueuzes Ive had, its almost like teak. Pours with a large white head which recedes to a half-finger depth. Aroma is basement funk, mouldy cheese, citric. Taste is sour green apples, slight lemon, hay, musty tartness.

Bottle from ølbutikken
Apple, farmhouse, hay, barnyard, orange, amber, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 Bottle. Hazy orange, small white head. Strong barnyard and acidic aroma, citrus, grapes. Taste is high sour, light vinegar character, funky, lemon, herbs, barnyard, wine. Very intense and deep. Aftertaste is long, dry and tart.

Crisp, mouthwatering sourness and stable.

Sour and really well balanced with sweetness, round fruitiness and stable. 

Just a classic nice sour!

750 ml bottle, thanks TimVim! Golden amber with thin white head. Aroma vinous, vinegar, tart notes, lemon na bretty notes. Taste is bretty, barnyard, light vinegar, tart and sour, lemon and bready malts. Nice!

De geur is zeker dik in orde, van de smaak zelf ben ik niet echt overtuigd. Vind hem met momenten echt plakkerig overkomen. 

Een geuze, een van de velen.
Sabor intenso acido. Olores tipicos de cervezas lambic. Gran espuma poco consistente. Cuerpo ligero.
Light apple juice in colour some head . Bottle at deli I rum brussels. Sour vinegar aroma earthy dank . Taste is sour with a touch of peach. Smooth palate.
Fantastic. Pours a hazy apricot colour. Aromas of stable and funk, cider vinegar, salt and vinegar chips. Flavours are funky and sour. But not too sour. Very well balanced and very good.

Lorsquon parle de gueuze, la black label de Girardin est une référence et elle ne lest pas sans raison. La bière est cuivrée, mousseuse et présente des arômes légèrement boisées, douces et fruitées. Le nez est délicat et dune complexité absolument fantastique! En bouche, lensemble verse dans un fruit mûr sans être sucré. Corps moyen, longue en bouche, jy détecte du raisin, de lorange et de la pêche, le tout sur un fond de lambic attendri. Absolument magnifique!

* Very nice sourish and balanced beer. The body is deep, nice wood and fresh intense horse blanket. Sourish fresh intense aftertaste. Very smooth-sourish with an interesting yeasty-smooth finish. Absolutely great!

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy light orange pour with a big bubbly magnolia head, aroma has tart lemon, some funk, taste has mellow sourness, along with tingly zesty lemon on the tongue, barnyard funk, some woodiness, excellent.

Orange golden a bit hazy, frothy medium dark-white head. Aromas of citrus, overripe apple, wood and light floral develop on the nose. Up front sweet with a pronounced tart- and sourness developing. Lightly slick, light bodied and dry. Lasting dry finish.

A bright mid amber coloured beer with a frothy but weak white head. A strong vinegary, cider apple aroma, with a slightly rubbery element. Dry mouthfeel. A super tart taste, vinegary first off, cider apple, then a further fruity addition of peach, lime and lemon. Theres a a woody spiciness in the finish that just adds an unexpected smoothness to the long and lingering finish.
Couleur jaune doree avec un col moyennement resistant. Aromes de fruits jaunes et de pommes bien acides. Elle manque un peu de maturation. Respectable dans lensemble!
Orangy pour, thumbs worth of head. Citrus and barnyard aroma, leather, berries as well. Sour tasting, citrus and berries, moderate funk note, leather. Lighter body.
Bottle (750 ml) @ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels 13/5-15. Fruity fresh and acidic with grapes and brett. Dry and tart finish.
Pours light orange with small white head. Medium malty aroma with bread and cookies. Earth and cheese in yeast. Very fuity, apricot, grape, lemon, apple. Good balance with sweetness and tart.

Bottle in garden, 7th June 15. Slightly hazy pour, aroma is heady straw, tart fruit, gooseberries. Taste is vinous, sour, but mellow, slight gooseberry, malts and old hops. Lovely, complex and classy beer

[2015] 37,5cl bottle. Hazy golden orange with a frothy white head. Flavors are hay, lemon, cheese, leather, oak and apples with grassy and acetic notes. Light to medium body, lively carbonation, smooth texture.
Hazy orange with white head. Loads of fruity brett in the aroma. Tart, lemon and earth finish. Overall: fruit forward and not to much funk.

375ml bottle at Waterhuis aan de Bierkant in Gent. Clear deep golden body, small white foam head. Aroma of lemons, sour cherries, barrel, old hops, grapefruit. Taste as you would expect is fresh and sour: lemons, sour cherries, a touch of leather, green grapes, lactic acid. Very nice and classy.
Une gueuze plus complexe que la "blanche", profonde, longue, puissante, fraîche et parfaitement équilibrée. Un délice.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2015 kindly shared by bartlebier@ (home)brewtasting 5/15; aromas and taste of sour cherries, wood, lacto, a hint of marzipan and bitter almond, vineyard peaches and forest strawberries with a mouldy edge becoming an earthy undertone.

Wonderful how this changes with time. Have to taste this vertically.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2015 Bottle (750 ml) @ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels 150513. Fruity and bretty, sour, grapefruity, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, fruity and sour. Fresh.

Thanks to bartlebier for sharing this beer with me
Orange, a bit hazy, full head.
Aroma: Blackberry, thyme, notes of citrus
Taste: Stong sourness, citrus, lactic acid. 
Very dry and fizzy finish.

Bottle thanks to errl. Hazy gold pour with a nice 1 finger head that fades to a nice film with a collar. Super funky aroma of feet, barnyard, sweat, grape skins, lemon peel, and some stone fruit. Tastes light to moderately sour. Moderately tart. Lots of barnyard, sweat, and leather. Finished with lemon juice, grape skins, and light peach. Pretty smooth and solid gueuze but not one of my favorites.

Bottle pour into a girardin tumbler. Pours a clear gold with a white head of foam. The aroma is musty and earthy and funky. The taste is fairly sour and juicy. Medium body and carbonation. Pretty solid.
UPDATED: MAY 9, 2015 This is just classic - just as a geuze is supposed to taste! Tart, acidic, dry, slightly funky, grape character, sour yogurt - mmmmm
UPDATED: JUN 24, 2016 Draft at Søernes. Taste is sour, tart, lemon very balanced at refreshing. Light body. Medium Carbonation.
In bottiglia da 37,5cl. Al palato aroma terroso, cantina, acido, limone, floreale. Carbonazione lievemente superiore ad altre gueuze. manca un pò di intensità nel finale che lascia la bocca asciutta.
Looks like apple juice. Woody aroma. Dry taste. Very tart and tangy with no carbonation.
Strong sour taste and aroma. Looks as gueuze. Wide palete, witg diferent nuances in it.
Light amber with medium off-white head. Sweet and sour aroma. Sourness in the taste is well balanced with certain sweetness followed by remaining soft bitterness.
Mostly clear until th bottom. Golden honey colour. Aroma is funkier that I expected. Tart lemon and green apple but a bit earthy and funky. Nice
UPDATED: APR 13, 2015 From bottle into snifter. Pale copper orange, small white head around the edges. Nice sour lemon, horse blanket. Light body good amount of sourness. Easy to drink, great.
Shared. Hazy orange colour. Lemony sour aroma. Dry, tart, citrus, sour, nice gueze!

37,5cl bottle at Van Moll brewpub, Eindhoven. Slightly hazy orange colour, slim foamy white head. White grapes, citrus fruity and light vinegar tardness, vanilla cask, very light barnyard earthy tones, malts are sweetening, smooth but dry finish. Fruity aftertaste. High carbonation, good body.

Bottle shared at the Cads. 5%. No date unfortunately. I picked it up 3 years ago. Hazy orange, small foamy white head, still. Aroma is lemon, earthy, sour. Body is medium, smooth, low carbonation. Taste is dry, lemony, floral, juicy, finishes crisp with an acidic linger. Good.

Bottle to glass. Pours a nice burnt orange color with an off white head. Aroma is a delicious tart fruits, light belgian yeast. Flavor has a good sour to it with a touch of sweetness to balance it out. Excellent gueuze!
UPDATED: MAR 22, 2015 Personally my favorite gueuze. Sour, yet balanced and complex beer. Marveously refreshing. Very nice when a little aged.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2016 15cl sample from bottle at the 9th Bruges Beer Festival 2016 (6 II 2016). Hazy and funk golden geuze with minimal white head. The nose is full of lemons, making very tart flavours. The carbonation is very high, and the sourness is vast. The texture of this 5% ABV geuze is thin, and the ending is sharp and sour, making a perfect thirst quencher. Great geuze, genuine tart brew.Previous rating (2 III 2015):15cl at the Ghent Beer Festival in 2014. In the glass one gets a lovely golden look. A very sour beer, even for a gueuze style. The finish is very nice. A genuine, great, tasteful beer of Girardin.
Ar=7;Ap=4;Ta=7;Pa=4;Ov=13;Total score=35/50
Pours a cloudy gold with a white head. Smell has a soft sweetness to it. Taste is dry and tart but with a soft and lasting finish.
Bottle to chouffe glass. Orange color. Minimal head. Maybe a little ring. Sour and fruity aroma. Taste follows. Im getting lots of tart apple. Finishes dry.

duft: æble. lidt yougurt. frisk. sur
smag: æble frisk frugt lidt sødme, æbleskral citrus
Bottle at home. Smells of fresh apples, some sourness there too. Color is orange with a nice bubbly head. Taste is dry, acid and a little bit less sour than other gueuzes. Good one!

Frankly, I was pretty disappointed by this. Bottle at Moeder Lambic Fontinas. Poured surprisingly clear, with some floaties in the bottom. Long lasting white head that stayed on the sides of the glass. Overly sweet for my liking, changing how the sourness came across. Citrus flavours. Who knows, maybe it wasnt the best bottle.
Essig, saurer Apfel, Aprikose, leicht rostige Noten. Recht sauer, bitter, extrem trockener Abgang.

0.375l bottle. Hazy dark golden body, white head. Aroma of mostly champagne-like yeast and brett, but it also has some fruity notes and some leather. Taste of grapefruit, apple cider and wood. Sour and dry at the same time. I liked the white label more, but this one is also nice.

The aroma has grapes and lemon zest and the first sip is a bit of a shocker. Quite bitter like citrus fruit rind. Im not the biggest lambic guy around, but this one is def worth a try. Really unique. Its white label brother was easier to drink and a bit more enjoyable for me, but both were something different for me. Thanks to Lagzi Lajcsi for sharing!

2010 vintage. Pours a hazy orange-golden with plenty of floaties and a thin eggshell head that settles to a thin ring and does not lace. Nose involves oak, cider vinegar, white grape, leather, mushroom, some dank musty cellar notes, tart under-ripe pit fruit like plum or apricot, plenty of earthy brett. Somewhat sweet, toward bracingly tart. Medium-light body, decent action, a bit slippery, very drying, finishing with a lingering earthy tartness that hangs around forever. Hearty yet refreshing, great brett character, very tart yet still drinkable, complex, a cool fortunate experience.
Op de bierproeverij met de gaya. Oranjegoud met een witte kraag mooi zure geur en smaak met appels. Mooie volle body

Older 37,5cl bottle - on cork till 2012. Murky unfiltered haze dark gold. Beautiful airy head. Lactic tart, sour, old lemon, soft brett. Round full body, low carbonation, soft soft soft. Amazing aging process happened here, on a relatively small amount of time (4 years?).

Har haft en del bedrövliga Girardin men den här varianten var trevlig. Subtil nyans av ättika men inte så det stör. Verkligen en av få bra Girardin. Minns nytappad kriek i Bryssel, men annars alltid besviken. Ren, härlig och balanserad. Inte så komplex, men ej heller några fel. Lättdrucken.
Dunkel lys gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av frukt og muggen kjeller. Smak av frukt og gjær. Syrlig og tørr ettersmak. Vinøse toner. Melkebaren.

Lukt: Sur duft av syrlige frukter.
Utseende: Litt dunkel gulbrun farge.
Skum/kullsyre: Lite skum, liten ring langs kant.
Smak: Frisk sur smak av forskjellige frukter. Noe tørr ettersmak.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2016 Bottle. Clear dark golden to light Amber with small off white head. Very herbal at first with wet wood, hay, dead leaves. Then some apricot and light malts. Old damp clothes, wool. Taste is light sweet with a long bitter finish and light tartness throughout. Medium bodied with light carbonation. Interesting stuff, a bit too bitter for me, and seems a bit unbalanced, but quite nice aroma. 3.8 
Bottle 75 cl thanks to sjogro. Seems way more fruity, less bitter and a bit more funky. A bit more sour too. Very good. 4.2

The appearance is pale golden color without foam not not worth writing about considering whats about to follow.
This is easily the most complex beer I had so far. It doesnt tell me what it is or what it want to be. The carbonation is stunning. Omnipresent and infinitesimal. The sourness I expected, is there but in an indirect way. The taste is so dry, you temporarily doubt that you have a liquid in your mouth. There are hints of apple in there, but difficult to grasp a descrete taste a can easily name.
This beer leaves me confused and probably wants to be tried by me when Im more worthy.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2017 This is a rather young one, 2014. Orange color with small head. First impression: Funk and citrus aroma. A bit phenolic. Wood. Taste is spritzy, but with a hint of sweet brown fermented apples (a hint of Apfelmost), hay, cheese (ziger?). A bit of citrus maybe as well. Moderate sourness. Crazy bitter dry aftertaste. Nice perlage carbonation. Among my favourite Gueuzes, although I usually prefer the really really sour ones. This one is more subtle and complex. Fantastic! 9-3-9-5-192003 bottle at Akkurat, tasted 2017-06-03. Red apples, cheesy feet, magical funk, a touch of a sherry-like nuttiness, dried fruits, a touch of cheesy feet and wet cellar. Immense complexity and tastiness. Low carbonation, but still way enough. I cant imagine a Gueuze becoming any better. 9-5-10-5-19.
375ml bottle. Slight funk and strong sour grape aroma. Taste same with nice dry sour finish. Really good stuff!

The fully traditional oude geuze Girardin, 100% lambic and no sugar added. Hazy orange blonde colour, thinnish off-white head. Exceptionally rich and complex aroma, lots of fruitiness, citric acid and lactic acid in perfect balance, sour cream, dry sherry, hay and all the funkiness offered by the best of lambics.
bottle. cloudy gold with small head. aroma of sour grapes, earthy hints and tart. taste is similar. dry and sour finish.
0,375l Flasche in Brügge. Goldklares Bier mit heller Schaumkrone. Riecht ein Bischen nach Käse. Schmeckt fruchtig, malzig, spritzig nach vergorenen Äpfeln und Trauben. Gut!

Corked 37.5 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy golden with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are wood, sour apples, tartness, and lemons - with a dry and slightly tart finish. High drinkability.

Wow. This fucking thing stinks! I absolutely love it. Amazing. Its a dusty attic. You want to delve more. Not super tart but balanced. Nearest fruit I would associate would be pure yuzu. Kind of tame on the front end but explodes there after. Last bottle of this EVER in my state. Honoured.

It pours golden with a slightly off white head. It has a tart and sweet smell. It also has the aroma of dried fruit. There are also yeast aromas. It has a tart taste with yeast. It has a bitter dry finish.
Licht troebel geel bier met schuim. Smaak is licht zuur en droog, iets voller dan de white label. Verder niet echt veel verschil., dus ook deze is gewoon erg goed.
Bottle at Biercab. Golden-orange colour with small white head. Funky, fruity, wood aroma. Sweet, fruity, sour, dust taste. Medium body.

375 ml bottle with a cork date of HX 2014. 
Aroma is really nice with a balanced amount of acidity and citrus with a medium light woodsy, herbal character. Light tropical fruit notes with moderate barnyard, horse blanket character. Really nice aroma. 
Pours a slightly cloudy, golden orange with a big, rocky, white head that recedes fairly quickly. 
Flavor has a moderately strong acidity with light citrus notes and a hint of acetic acid. Light tropical fruit and a touch of a weird phenolic, herbal note. Moderate barnyard funk, but lighter than in the aroma. Light oak notes Medium light herbal, woodsy, earthy character. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a really nice beer. If the flavor could catch up to the aroma this would be amazing, but right now it is just really good.

Many thanks to ElManana for this bottle. Trübes orangegelbes Bier mit geringer aber stabilen leicht beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr fruchtig, leicht holzig, süß, dezente Säure. Geschmack angenehm säuerlich fruchtig, reifes Obst, sehr malzig, leicht holzig, vergorene Äpfel, gut!

37.5 CL bottle, Bierkoning. Amsterdam.
A sweet nose. White wine, hints of vinegar, fruits. Taste is quite sweet, wine like but with a slightly sour finish. It is quite well balanced but not one of my favourite Geuzes.

375 ml bottle from BierKompass, Germany. Yellow golden color, not so hazy, with a huge white head. Aromas of sour and tart lemon, barnyard. Taste is realy sour, like chewing a lemon, with ntes of hay, barnyard, some tart and acidic elements. Aftertaste is sour and long. Light body with medium carbonation.

14-NOV-2014, bottle @Neis, Ulkløbben meeting.
Hazy orange with lasting White head. Aroma is tart with brett. Taste the same with lemon. Very tart. medium body and carbonation. Very nice and quite complex.

Bottle 0.375l at Pozarevac Ultimate Beer Tasting Serbia with ippopotamo36 and luttonm.Thank you Alberto.Pour it hazy golden color with medium white head.Aroma of fruits, citrus, grape.Taste is sour but perfectbalanced, not so sharp.Dry in the middle. Perfect best geuze I try untli now.

At a private tasting in Serbia with markoijelena and luttonm. "Pour it"cloudy and slightly hazy golden/orange, white gassy foam. Nose: light acetic feel, round citrus notes. Mouth: very balanced and round acetic balance between vinegar and green apple/grapefruit. Great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle..Pour is golden with a thin white head..Nose is funk cheese, dry, herbs..Taste is barrel, dry, oak , soft funk, cheese

375ml bottle from beermerchants.com. Clear deep orange-gold amber colour, frothy white foam head leaving lacing and aroma of zesty lemon rind, wood, funk, yeasty. Taste is sour tangy lemon citrus, woody notes, fruity yeasty, barnyard, some bitterness. Oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry sour and bitter finish. Lovely stuff, very drinkable!

Multiple bottles, both aged and fresh. This rating is for a fresh sample. Clear copper-orange with a white head that receeds in a lasting ring of foam. Aroma is classic barnyard that you get from the best gueuzes, green apples, brett, grain, hay. Funk is rather moderate. Taste is deliciously tart, wood, leather, lemon and a light fruity sweetness. One of the most quaffable fresh gueuze out there. Among the best, definitly the best quality/price ratio you can get.

375ml bottle served in a tulip.
Corked bottle. REF C X 2013 stamped in the cork. Made big pop when opened. 
A: Pours a golden bit cloudy yellow color forming a huge white fluffy and highly bubbled head. Good retention. The head never disappears completely, leaving tons of lacings and chunks of foam in the glass
S: Very fruity as expected. Strong notes of white grapes and green apples. Tart and vinegar. Light notes of grains. Lambic yeasts. A little bit metallic too
T: Very fruity and tart. Not extremely tart. In fact, the first sip is quite tart but from the second you can realise that this is a considerably smooth wild beer. Strong notes of white grapes and green apples. Lambic yeasts are also bit earthy. In overall, a dry beer with intense tartness. End is a bit bitter and metallic
M: Light body. Extreme carbonation. Tart and fruity aftertaste
O: Very drinkable. Extremely smooth and easy drinking Gueuze. In the same level of a Drie Fonteinen or a Cantillon. Mandatory to wild beer lovers
[ BA Review @ 11/11/2012 ]

!!! Attention !!! commentaire suite à une dégustation de bière vieille 3 ans en cave !
Belle mousse qui dure longtemps.
Nez brett, avec une touche de fromage et dumami.
Belle complexité avec une légèreté. Très belle durée avec un goût très équilibre. Acidité noble et pas agressive.

Encore meilleure avec le temps, plus la bouteille vieille plus elle devient meilleure ?

Pours a cloudy orange brew with a medium white head with regular retention , aroma is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy sour with grapefruit, sur fruits and wood, medium bodied, flavor is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy sour with a sweet and sour finish and a medium aftertaste, very good
Wow Im surprised given the price. Plums and apricot, nice sourness. Well balanced gueuze with a beautiful color. I Love it!

Bottle at home. Vintage 2010. Pours a hazy oransje colour with a medium, off-white head. Aroma of rowanberries, oak, forest floor, citrus and some horse. The flavour follows up with more berries, oak, grapefruit, apple, citrus and cider. Has a soft and slick mouth feel, and a light bitterness. A great and well balanced gueuze. Solid one.

Golden yellow with a fluffy white head. Aroma is apple cider vinegar, lemon zest, dry white wine, funk, hint of cheddar. Light-medium bodied, tart and dry on the palate, acidic finish. Taste is dry white wine,  lemon zest , gooseberry, wood.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2015 Bottle shared at home. Pours cloudy golden amber with small foamy head. Aroma of vinegar, white wine, and horse stable. Very tart taste with hay, vinegar, and a little medicine. Pretty good for a 5 % gueuze, but nothing special.

37,5 cl, flaske, 5,0 % ABV, købt i Barley Wine i CPH City, 14. september 2014.
Kobberfarvet og ufiltreret Geueze med mindre hvid 1 cm tyk skumkrone, som svinder langsomt. 
Aromaen er ikke kæmpe tydelig, men der er noter af grapefrugt, appelsinskal, citrus, stald og Brettanomyces gær. 
Smagen er sur, men velafbalanceret på en lidt uforklarlig måde. Smagen mildnes til noget bittert sidst i billedet og afsluttes meget pludseligt, men det bitter/sure hænger lidt ved. 
Opsummering: middel til kraftig sur, let bitter og zero sødme. 
I munden er der øl med medium fyldig krop og en del kuldioxid, som kun får det bedre at stå lidt og bruse af. Konsistensen er oily til cremet. 
Måske den bedst afbalancerede Geueze, jeg har smagt og fortræffelig til at balancere en ølaften, tænker jeg.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2014 Bottle @ Elfos Pub, Perugia, Italy. Pours with a hazy beautiful bright colour, small short-lasting white head. Aroma has notes of fruit, especially grape, complex. Taste is softly sweet, medium to heavy sour.
Palate is little to medium body, watery texture, average carbonation.

375 ml bottle at Hoppy Pub Thessaloniki. Golden color with nice white head. Aroma is sweet sour, musty, funky, fruity. Taste is light sweet, quite salty and a little sour. Light body, soft carbonation.

375ml Bottle - Amber in colour. Sultanas, dried apricot and musty notes in the aroma. Refreshing and fairly tart taste with wood, dried fruit and some slightly sharp musty notes. An authentic yet fairly accessible gueuze.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2014 Bottle. Pours hazy golden yellow, nice regular white head. Aroma is tart apples, clean brett and a bit stall. Taste is sour, tart and soft carbonation. This gueuze is based on the fruity, but citric apply sourness. Some wood. Quite dry.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2015 Wow. Incredibly complex aroma of fruit, tart apple, brett funk, cellar notes, wood. Flavour is masterfully tart, well-balanced sourness. Finish is very dry. Really, the balanced and compelling way the aroma and flavour interplay is a stroke of brilliance. Best Gueuze Ive had to date, and probably my favourite beer altogether. I will drink this at every opportunity.

Bottle poured at Tipples Rare and Barrel Aged Beer Tasting on July 13, 2014. Pours light yellowish gold with a small rim of white head on top. Aroma of candi sugar and mint leaves, dry, dusty, light citrus. Flavor is funky like my gym socks. Whoah. Some lemon notes, dry oakiness, and some vanilla as well here. More chewy body than other gueuzes in the class that Ive had, and low plus carbonation. Nice brew overall, and a bit of a change-up from the LP Gueuze earlier in the night. Recommended.

Bottle from bieresgourmet.be webshop. Pours a slightly hazy orange body with a large white head. Nose is lemon, lime, straw, hay, horse blanket, tart red berries and hints of barnyard funk and burnt rubber. Taste is bretty barnyard funk tones, burnt rubber, straw, hay, tart red berries, citric peel and hints of lemon, lime and stable funk. Complex, with a dry finish and a crisp, clean mouthfeel. Tart, yet balanced. Funky, yet strangely accessible. I like it. A lot.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2016 The fully traditional oude geuze Girardin, 100% lambic and no sugar added. Hazy orange blonde colour, thinnish off-white head. Exceptionally rich and complex aroma, lots of fruitiness, citric acid and lactic acid in perfect balance, sour cream, dry sherry, hay and all the funkiness offered by the best of lambics. Taste has all the barnyard one would expect from a traditional lambic beer, vinegar, yoghurt and lemon, sour fruits, all in perfect balance, long and very complex finish, woody and funky in a totally elegant way with a perfectly dosed champagne-like carbonation. Its elegance and balance make it the best of the regularly produced geuzes, at least to my opinion. Masterpiece and a great advertisement for the utter complexity of the products of lambic land.  Geuze does not get much better than this - a false contrast, perhaps, with the artisanal, modest, almost shy way this brewery operates.

750ml 2003 vintage at Akkurat with Taylor. Pours light orange, with white head that drops to a layer of bubbles. Aroma is subtle, nice funky zest, very low acidity, Gueuze. Taste is refreshing Gueuze with very low acidity, at 11 years of age this thing is drinking absolutely fantastic. Rounded citrus funkiness that is light and refreshing, complex. This is exactly even with drie Fonteinen for me, if not superior (though I have not had black label fresh yet)
Bottle @midlaren with dutchdrebus. Hazy yellow color with a white head. Smells and tastes sour, fruity, apple.

Bottle @ Midlaren holiday. Nice orange golden colour with a small white head that doesnt last. Smells sourish, dusty, cellar, fruity, nice. Tastes sourish, dusty, fruity, some mint, nice. Medium body, soft carbo.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2015 Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow with a thin (!) white head. Aromas of citrus, green apple, vinegar, orange peel, grass, yeast, stale and straw. Taste is mildly tart, bittersweet, straw and grass. Mild orange, citrus and grapefruit.

37,5cl
Appearance: Murky amber with wit small white head
Aroma:Granny Smith apple, oak, Lim, hay, vinegar and earthy notes and some funk
Taste: Tart, white wine vinegar,, with Granny smith balanced by bit of sweetness and hay.
medium body, average carbonation.

Refreshing, but the tartness is not for everyone.
Ik drink graag geuze, maar dit was absoluut mijn ding niet. De smaak beviel me absoluut niet.
Golden slightly hazy, thin white head. Not comparable to the filtered version. Very decent gueuze, balanced.
37,5cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Orange hazy color. Head is thin and white. Body is medium and finish is long. Taste is high sour, low sweet. Aroma is earth, mushrooms, herbs, citrus, smoke, wood.
Wundervolles Lambic, das dirch eine kräftige, jedoch nicht brutale Säure besticht. Nuancen von pfirsichen, himbeeren, etwas buttersäure und gar zucker. Fein, balanciert, würzig.

Bottle kindly shared by Bamsen78 - thank you a lot, Marcin! Pours out in a hazy dirty amber colour with airy low head and medium body. Aroma of vinegar, green nuts and unripe berries. Taste of unripe berries, white wine vinegar, pinot grigio grapes, light green nuts and acid. The acidity is very well-balanced and makes this lambic just wonderful to drink. Loved it.

Bottle shared with McTapps & MichaelAwesome. Pours murky amber with wit small white head. Clear vinous aroma with notes of yeast and fruity touches. Clear, dry and vinous aroma with dusty and fruity notes and touches of hops. Lingering vinous aftertaste, with notes of yeast. Great.

2011 bottle. Thanks to Mathieu.

A: Cloudy light copper. Thin white head. Very little lacing.


N: Grapefruit rind, Granny Smith apple, oak, dust and mustiness. Lemons and some funk and cedar floorboards. 

T: Really good sourness with a light sweetness. 

M: Light body. Dry.

O: Really nice development after 3 years. Has some more of the deep oak and funk. Recommended as its similar to Cantillion.
Lambic is ot my favourite but this beer is extremely good. Taste of lime maybe or general yeasty smell and test. Top beer.

Bottle from Bruges. Pours bright amber with a thin white head and lots of carbonation. Starts with sharp lime notes before oak and earthy flavours come in. Very zingy and refreshing. Good beer, especially for a summers day.

Drank many times, most recently at Bobbys Girardin tasting. Pours a hazy darker yellow with medium foam. Aroma of damp oak, lemon, barnyard funk, wet earth. Pure lambic palate, with flavors of lime, old oak barrel, wet hay, acid, almost Champagne-like red fruit. Dry, pure and super refreshing, outstanding.

Bottle 37.5 cl from Kihoshk, CPH. Hazy nice orange with a very thin white head. Gooseberries, white grapes, slight barnyard, quite a bit of quite wine, tart, hint of bitterness. Light body, dry, medium/high carbonation, tart finish.

Tart funky aroma, overripe fruits, goose berries, manure and stable, but in a good way. Hazy orange white head. Sour tart taste, bit of bitterness but very subtle, mostly dry tartness, some strawberries. Light lively carbonation very dry. Fantastic, just what I want from a Geuze

Une mousse plutôt timide sinstalle sur une robe blonde aux reflets orangés. Des odeurs funky et de pommes vertes explosent au nez et sont précurseurs dune bière à lacidité prenante en bouche. Cette acidité est en effet dominante sans jamais toutefois être désagréable. Pommes, citrons et céréales sallient pour former des gorgées délicieuses à chaque fois. Superbe.

Shared 75cl bottle with a friend. Poured a slight cloudy golden colour with a white head. Citrus, apples, oak, yeast, acid, bread, awesome tart taste, grapefruit, Great sourness. One of the best in its style. And a very Great price!

Bottle. Dark golden in colour, small white head. In aroma sour, citrussy. In taste very tart, some barnyard funky notes with sour and low bitter finish. Medium bodied, lively carbonated. Very good gueze.
Purchased @ 3 Rivers of Longmont. Poured golden/copper. Sediment in bottle neck. Defined barnyard horse blanket flavor. True to style.

75cl bottle chilled for about an hour. Cork came out with explosive force, decanted into a jug. Citrussy and sour aroma. Beautiful orange-gold colour with a small off-white head. Taste is wonderful, lemon/grapefruit with a sour edge. Lively feel on the tongue, with more citrus balanced with a small amount of sweetness. Ends dry, leaving you wanting more.
Truly an outstanding beer. Quenching and yet satisfying, light on alcohol means this is a great summer drinker. Will be having another bottle as this is one experience I dont want to end.

375 ml bottle at home. Pours a hazy golden color with a large fluffy white head. The aroma and flavor have sour lemon citrus, tart apples and peaches, barnyard funk, Brett, some acidity. This is easy to drink even with the funk and sour character.

Full, rich, creamy mouthfeel. Very pleasant and mild sourness. Good long finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

And now for my 3,000th rating. 
This is a beer I first tried about two years ago at Kronieksken in Liedekercke, previous to that Edmund Edmunds, aka Lushawn, aka GuardOfTheCellar, aka Loineshawn, aka KysHub69, aka Drake, aka SrSilligoose, aka Possum Aloisious Jenkins, aka a generous soul from the good old days gifted me this much sought after cx 2010 vintage of the beer out of the goodness of his heart. Fedex promptly put a big ol hole in the box, but it eventually got to me. I could think of no better beer to celebrate my 3,000th rating than this one, that I already love from a bottle gifted to me by one of the chillest bros this community has to offer. 



Pours a deep golden with a big champagne like rise and fall head & millions of tiny bubbles keeping a thin layer of foam continually forming atop the beer. 

The aroma is lemony & wooody with some pleasant almost cork like notes. Its funky in a sort of mild way but it does have a good lot of sour fruit going on in the aroma. Some white grape, some barnyard, some sea breeze.... Pungent & inviting. 

The flavor is bracingly dry, rustic & earthy. There is a very defined citrus peel in this one sourness, bitterness & all. The lemony character is very bright but the general sourness of the beer is Id say at a moderate level for the style, and really very moderate for this particular beer. This is just outright fantastic. 

The mouthfeel is prickly as champagne & sharp up front with a long finish. 

Beautiful, thank you Shawn.
Nose is very pleasing, acid. Taste is superb, very well balanced. Bottle from Geers.

Peachy color with a medium foam collar. Aromas of wild yeasts, bacterias, spices, aromatic hops and lemon. Flavors of wild yeasts, bacterias, spices, aromatic and floral hops, lemon, wood and a little bit of caramelized malt. Couleur pêche avec un moyen col de mousse. Arômes de levures sauvages, bactéries, épices, houblon aromatique et citron. Saveurs de levures sauvages, bactéries, épices, houblon aromatique et floral, citron, bois et malt carramélisé.
Good gueuze lambic, very sour but with a nice malty character and cereals well balanced, so drinkable
Aroma: sour, fruits, bitters. Appearance: hazy pale gold, no head. Taste: medium bitter. Palate: bitters intensify, sour fruits. Overall: great Gueze, nice aroma.
37.5 cage and cork bottle. Not nearly as sour as I expected. Has some sour but nothing close to the 3F OG. Some funky yogurt on the aroma as it warms up. A bit metallic on the back end.

Bottle at home shared with Dan. Pours a clean golden color with a small head that lasted around the ring. Small snifters. Aroma is funk, barn, apples, white grapes, slight vinegar, slight fart, and animal hair. The taste was tart fruits like pears, apples, apricots, white grapes along with a funky barnyard. Very light body, crisp and refreshing overall. Tart finish with the fruits that lasted on the palate. The only drawback was the egg/farty aroma.
Bottle. Pours clear yellow/gold with no head. Aroma is funk, earthy, cut grass, lemon peel. Taste is lemon, a bit of leather, tart, granny smith apple. Amazing.

Color ámbar claro, espuma blanca ligera. Aromas de fruta verde, herbales y brett. En boca es ligera y fresca con un intenso sabor de frutas verdes bien equilibrado entre la ácidez y el dulzor y muy elegante. El regusto sigue siendo afrutado y fresco. Muy rica.
Una gueuze fenomenale. Maltazione e luppolatura donano a questa birra un insieme di sapori bilanciato ed armonico pur senza ammazzare lacidità tipica dello stile. Imperdibile!

Orange hazy beer with a persistent small white head. Aroma has typical lambic aromas such as vinegar, white wine and saddle leather but also lots of fruity sweetness. Flavor is fruity dry with white grapes, sourness, citrus and apricot. Palate is medium full and sparkling. Finish is sour, crisp and bitter. A refreshing gueuze, a good balance between sweet and sour.

Clear golden pour with a quickly disapearing white head. The nose has lots of sour apples and barnyardy notes and even slight handbag too.. The mouthfeel is light and lively with a perfect amount of carbonation. The taste is really refreshing with lots of funk, sour apples and just general tartness all over. A real go-to gueuze

375ml bottle from beergusto. Pours clear gold, thick white head, which high carbonation keeps in place. Aromas are cider apples, barnyard hay, funk. Taste is sour lemons, more apples, like raw cooking apples. Medium body, crisp sour finish. Lovely.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2014 Pours yellow with a disappearing head. Aroma is barnyard, very earthy, some hay, very complex. Taste is of grapefruit rind, some lemony, a lot of hay, some tonic inputs, taste a lot better warmer and its not very carbonated which is highly appreciated.

Aroma: Smelling of funky bread, apple, leather and stable.Appearance: A clear amber colored beer. A off-white head with small lacing and some curtains.Taste: Tasting bread, citrus, grass, leather, yeast and peel.Palate: High carbonation, a sticky texture. A medium body with a slightly dry finish.Overall: Wonderful with cheese. Bretty delight!Note: Bottle 375 ml at home. Reviewed 2014-04-13.
Bottle @ Maxi. Slightly hazy, small white head, some lacing. Aroma, lemon/lime, grass, brett, fruity acidity. Taste, malty, tart, brett, acid, lemon/lime, grass.
Excellent....almost perfect. Acidity is spot on with fruity green apple with slight pear finish. Little white head....almost sparkling wine type

2013 cork. Pours a clear copper in color with a fluffy and sticky head, nice lacing. The aroma is very barnyard with a high funky presence. There is also an acidic fruit scent along with subtle sweet notes in the background. As for tasting the beverage was noticeably tart, it had cherry fruit acidic flavors, and a mild yeast like character. As the drink warms it becomes a tad more tame and not overpowering to my taste buds. The finish had a weak bitter sweet flavor that was diminished by the acidic tartness of the ale. Overall a nicely done gueuze.

Pours an unclear golden orange, effervescent with pillowy white head. Smell is funky, hay, lemons, apples, (in the voice recording I yell at my kid here about slamming doors). Taste is lightly tart, lemon, citrus splashes, apple juice, slight vinegar. Quite nice.

2013 bottle to glass. Straw golden pour with white head that dissipates quickly but leaves a nice collar of foam. Pronounced barnyard funk. Taste is heavy funk and sour. Tannic finish. Notes of lemon tart and sweetness. Good classic example but not as smooth as others Ive enjoyed more. Salty lemon aftertaste.
Rosy golden pour with quickly diminishing head. Aroma of vinegar, barnyard, orange blossoms. Flavor is a light citrusy sour, lemon, currant, and yeast. Awesome beer.

Bottle. 5.0%. Best before? Cork says Ref C X 2009. Pours a hazy orange/amber with a diminishing off-white/yellowish head. Slight lacing. Mild aroma; tart, sweet, fruity/berry aroma with a horse blanket note. Flavour is sour and fruity with a horse blanket note. Dry finish with a grape fruit bitterness. Lingering sour note and a light note of apricot. 14.03.14.

BOTTLE 37.5CL from Belgium in a Box.

Look: hazy golden-amber with a small sparkling white head with poor retention.
Aroma: funk, green fruit acidity, some sweetness,/honey, acacia. 
Taste: Strong but not overwhelming acidity, some sweetness/fruit, yest, finishes with mild bitterness and green fruit astringency and fruit stone nuttiness.
Has some fruity/honey notes, but mostly is like any other lambic.
White head with bubbles streaming up keeping it at two fingers, golden clear color. aroma of grape, similar to white wine sour but some sweetness to back it up. Taste: very tart
Pale amber coloured. Extremely complex with balanced, tart acidity. One of few beers that combines being both very flavourful and very refreshing.

Bottled from Ølbutikken
Golden with a medium, white head. 
Really sour and tart aroma with rubber and lemon/lime. 
Very sour flavour; citrus, rubber and diesel. 
Medium bitterness. 
Very refreshing!

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2014 Bouteille 375ml, gracieuseté de BlogueDeBieres, Merci! Couleur orangée translucide, mousse blanc cassé abondante et aérienne. Arôme de paille humide, brett, fruité, vinaigre léger, poussiéreux? Goût de brett qui enveloppe le palais, viniagre de cidre, acidité moyenne, sèche, légère amertume en fin de bouche, citron en arrière-goût. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen.
lime, and herbal aromas. unclear yellow appearence. realy sour taste. sparkling mouthfeel with a small sour aftertaste

Pours a hazy, orangy/amber, three finger, dense white head which lasts throughout. A bit of sediment floating around. Aromas of orange peel, lemons, apple, straw, pine, fresh flowers, mustiness, tangy, doughy yeast. Taste- very impressive- lots of bitterness, very lemony and piney, huge sourness, tart fruit, bitter finish, lots of carbonation. Really refreshing- excellent.
The beer is not too sour, but nicely tart and balanced. Very dry and medium bodied. Some aroma of barnyard. Complex balanced intruiging beer.

375ml bottle. Clear, orangey golden colour with average, frothy to macropore, diminishing, minimally lacing, white head. Complex floral, fruity, yeasty aroma has bretty notes, hints of citrus, chewing gum, oak, grapes, a spicy, peppery, yeasty touch that almost bites in the nose. Taste is mildly tart, dry, hints of fruit acid, oak, grapes. I can see the complexity, but Im still not into this style.
Bottle at home. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma is yeast, acidic, fruits, pineapple, floral and some bread. Taste is heavy sour and light sweet. Medium bodied with lively carbonation.

Bottle from trade with Countbeer, many thanks my friend. orange golden color with medium white head. Aroma of oak, citrus, honey, tangerines, brett, vinous notes. Tart taste with vinous notes, lemon, earthy notes, oak, brett, residual sugar. Nice tart finish. Very tasty Gueuze.

Couleur laiton, hautement carbonatée, elle émet en nez des notes de vin blanc, et certains houblons herbacés font surface. En bouche, vivifiante et sèche, vin blanc et boisé, pas trop sucrée, très pétillante mais pas à lexcès. Savoureuse, charpentée, délicieusement sûrette mais bien balancée, cest une gueuze classique, possiblement un des plus ressemblantes à du champagne. Si on aime le style, cest une incontournable.
Bottle at Brasserie Cambrinus. Amazing geuze - tart and dry with superb head unlike any other of this style. Great balance with hint of sweetness. Lovely mouthfeel so refreshing.
