37.5 cL bottle at home. Pours almost clear golden with a large white head. Aroma of barnyard, funk, tart, some sweetness, wood and a bit of citrus. Aroma somewhat reminds me of cleaning the stable of the calves when I was young. Taste has a nice balance between the sweetness and a soft to medium sourness. Some funk and barn in the taste. Medium body and a nice medium carbo. Good stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2014 1/ 37,5cl bottle @ Metafoor, Leuven (A8, Ap3, T8, P3, Tot15)
2/ 75cl bottle @ The Capital, Leuven (A7, Ap3, T8, P4, Tot 15)
Aroma has something dusty (barn), sourish, cheesy, a bit apple, natural.
Pours orange, off-white head fades but a tiny layer lasts.
Light sour, popcorn, apple, pepper, cheesy
Finish is sour and dusty barn, yet dry.
Fresh & dry with animal notes & citrus. Clear pale with large white head. Fresh sourness. Medium body, sticky texture & soft carbonation.
Great beer. Very sour and fresh, with a subtle taste of wood in it. This is how a gueuze should be.

Con questa chicca Girardin raggiunge le vette degli altri grandi maestri belgi della fermentazione spontanea, redimendosi per i suoi sciroppini alla frutta generalmente mediocri. Pesantemente acida, si conclude con un finale secco che fissa sul palato il prurito tipico del lambic, arricchito da note citriche e da qualche lieve tocco spieziato. Ottima, senza dubbio.
Smak och doft av gröna äpplen, gräs, jäst, citron, med toner av vått trä, vita vinbär och grapefrukt. Syrlig och frisk. Med en lite pepprig ton i efterbeskan. Välbalanserad, riktigt fint.
The head is ok, body orange and cloudy. It smells aromatic, sour, natural. The taste is sour, aromatic, really sour, coriander, pepper. Interesting and tasty.
Bottled. A hazy yellow beer with a small disappearing white head. Aroma is fruity and sour, some citrusy notes. Taste is very sour, citrusy fruits. Dry finish with wood notes
Bottle with some friends NYE. Pours murky gold, thin white head. Nose of horse blanket, bologna, fuel. Taste is light tart, dry finish, medium body. Taste of poppy seed, vinegar, horse taint

Bottle at home from Dranken Geers. Aroma is funk, rubber and chive, sick, with a light sharpness Golden orange colour with a light light white froth. Flavour is horsey, funk, pineapple, apple, some grape skins, and nice tartness / puckering. Very aproachable and drinkable and very complex. Nice effervesent medium carbonation and super dry finish. Tasty.
Fruity and funky. Very sour. Vinegary. Really enjoyed it, but its hard to compare it against non-sour beers.

Cork: Dx 2011 (dunno what this means)

A: pours a toasted honey ale with a single finger of bone white foam which falls to a sheet of the same. There is spotty lacing over the excellently clarified beer. 

S: Huh, excellent mix of lemon, tart, feces (barn style), hay, mammal hair, and more sourness. Well balanced nose; which I dont think Ive ever said about a beer.... Really digging this nose, not too farmy and funky, not too sour and abrasive.

T: Lemon. Strait up lemons. Okay, okay, maybe hints of calcific rinds, some nice earth tones. You know, when I review a Geuze, Im always uncertain how to really articulate all the nuances of the beer. Its fucked (my brain). By the way, this is good.

M: Light body, hi carb; spot on for the style. Dry finish.

O: Good stuff. Im really happy about this one. I really dig the balance on the nose, additionally the flavor profile is really satisfying. Man, I wish this genre were more accessible and less expensive..

Serving type: bottle

08-18-2011
Bu en bouteille de 37.5cl, une jolie bière qui mousse parfaitement, en bouche on ressent un grand côté abricot fruit jaune, un vrai plaisir à ressentir.
375 ml @ home. Pours golden with a beautiful off white head. Aroma is tart and hoppy. Taste is a bit hoppier than expected. Nice balanced sourness.
Bottle. Hazy orange pour with a white head. Sour nose with hay, horse blanket, fruit, leather. Acidic taste but not vinegar. Good!

Bottle to goblet
Lemon, sweat, mushroom, and lacto. Cloudy amber with a reddish tinge and a long lasting white head. Sooouuuuuur...woo hoo...what a kick, lemon and sour apple.
Bottle - Funky sour lemon and grass. Cloudy gold with a bubbly white head. Tart lemon and horse blanket. Tartness follows into finish and cleanly disappears.

1ste gueuze met Bryan.kleur appelgoud. Eerste smaak zuur(appel) champagne achtige. Veel CO2.op het einde trekken de smaak.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fles gedeeld met lachneger. Ziet er uit als appelsap met prik, bijna geen schuim. Ruikt fris zuur. Smaak is vol zuur, licht bittertje. Mooi geuze biertje.

Bottle: slightly hazy, golden color with orange-ish hues thrown about; beaming white head that fizzles out quickly & loud like Alka-Seltzer. Aroma is funk-city. One of the funkiest gueuze out there, joining the ranks of Drie Fonteinen & Cantillon. Sweaty feet, dirty old horseblanket, musty & damp bales of hay. Ripping ripe & sour apple skins, lemon flesh, & mild white grape notes. Oak finish joins the funk & the tart nicely. Taste is very tart up front; under-ripe green apple & old lemon peels, mild acidity with notable lacto yeast. Sourness mellows mid-way into critter town with tannic oak, barnyard must, sweaty & cheesy funk. Finish of stone fruit-y acidity, mild hay, & drying oak. Ripping dry finish. Underrated gueuze, IMO... Great stuff.
Botella. Aroma y sabor a cuadra. Deliciosa gueuze con un grandísimo cuerpo no como otras que están más aguada, sé no ta muchísimo más la malta que en otras. Más dulce y menos acidas que lo habitual.

Bière orangée, trouble, avec une belle mousse éphémère à petites bulles. Une mince dentelle réside. Le nez est fruité, sec et sauvage, avec un peu de «bonbon» en périphérie. En bouche, lacidité mène le bal avec de douces notes de fruits rouges et de pamplemousse rose. On mord carrément dans le fruit. La finale, sèche, tombe à pic sans laisser trop de place à larrière-goût. Cette gueuze est un classique indémodable qui fera toujours honneur à son style.

Leffervescence est massivement coussinée et des effluves de pommes surettes et dagrumes envahissent la pièce. Des notes dherbes mouillées et dune douceur sucrée sajoutent. Le champagne de la bière prend tout son sens.

Pours murky, lively finger white head. 

Smell is funk and diapers. 

Taste tart lacto and brett, bit of bandaid. Tart and funky.

Lighter bodied

Ok
Bottle. Golden with white head. Aroma & taste is apple, yeast, lemon, vineger. Feels sour, dry and bitter.
Pours a fairly clear light golden color. Big funk aroma, cheese like. Big funky flavor as well, horse blanket, semi tart, light citrus. Very tasty and complex gueuze, highly recommend.
Bottle at tuulensuu, tampere. Almost clear light golden color, white head. Aroma is real earth, sour fruity notes, peach. Sour fruity taste, sweet notes, peach, citrus notes. Very nice gueuze.

Bottle. No idea of the vintage.
Hazy orange with a off white head. 
Sweet and sour aroma at the same time. Green apples, tart.
Taste is tart, citrusy/grapefruity bitter, slight pepper and wood?
Dry mouthfeel, high carbonation.
Citrusy bitter ending.
Slightly hazy amber pour with a big fluffy white head. Funky nose. Sour barnyard-ish, wet hay. Tart and acidic taste, dry and bitter citrus rind finish. Really wonderful stuff!
37,5cl bottle. Courtesy of Olivier. Very tart, highly acidic aroma. Smooth vanilla melds with vinegar. Highly salty. Fun.
Got some good teast in it medium sour and very drinkable and refreshing in the back
Fantastic gueuze. Huge lemon sour burst in this one. Really sour. Super funky smell. Everything you would want in a gueuze. Would want this again definitely. You need to try this brew.

Bottle, 10/9/2013. Cloudy orange pour, medium white head dies to rest effervescent on the surface, thin ring of lacing piled around the glass. Aroma begins with slightly musty barnyard notes, opening into mild sour fruitiness, grapefruit with lighter touches of apple, white grape, wood in the finish. Taste is lemon citrus, bitter grapefruit, tartness not over the top, funk and wood in a dry finish. Light, crisp refreshing body, highly drinkable, well balanced. Great gueuze.

Pours a bright orange with an almost non-existent head.

Smells of funk some sour light fruits (pears, apricot) and a little bit of white wine.

Starts out with a very sour tart lemon flavor. I get a few hints of sour cherry throughout the flavor as well. Slightly funky, but leaves a good tart aftertaste.

Fairly light mouthfeel with high almost champagne carbonation levels.

I dont have much experience in gueuzes and after the smell was a bit worried, but the tartness more than balanced out the funk and it ended up being a very enjoyable beer.
A sour flavor with sweet floral notes. Color is brownish amber with a white head.

Bottle traded by JRob21 (thanks, bro). Aroma is bandaid funk, barnyard, lemon seed, and rubber ball. Pours hay colored with a big fizzy head. Taste is tart and funky with barnyard, lemon peel, band-aid, and plastic. Great gueuze. Would recommend to all.
Bottle at Kulminator. Hazy golden color with a tiny foamy head. Nice sour nose, citrus. Taste is citrusy, sour, dry. Long dry finish. Too young will age well.
Bottle. Pours a bubbly amber. Aroma of tartness and fruit. Taste of sourness with nice carbonation.

375 mL bottle in trade from tom10101. (Merci, Tommy.) Hazy gold-brown with a ring of white head. Very sharp, fruity aroma - unripe pear, tart green apple, that sort of thing. The flavour is more restrained than the aroma, but there is an interesting herbal note near the end that I havent noticed in other examples of the style. This one certainly doesnt do the sweet&sour thing, either. It is definitely on the tart side. Very nice beer.

Flaska från BW Köpenhamn, Orangegul, disig lågt vitt skum. Stor stalldoft och våt hästfilt, snäll syrlighet med gröna äpplen och fat. Distinkt men ganska snäll syra, istället är det stallkaraktären som sticker ut, lätt grapebeska, grapesyrlig, fuktigt färskt trä. Riktigt riktigt god.

Had many times, rating for the first time. 375ml bottle. Gx2013. Poured into a solo cup, so I cant comment on the color, but it looks yummy. Big sour nose, grapefruit pulp, grass, lemon, band aid, funk. Flavor is tart and sweet, light acid, lemon, grapefruit, earthy grass, funk. Tart but lightly sweet finish too. Really nice. Best with some years on it.
A very great gueuze, seems to champagne/cider in some senses but with his personality (isnt very sour). Great value for money. Evolving taste with time.

37,5cl bottles, new batch. Finally getting round to rating this deliciously balanced, moderate Geuze. Nicely carbonated for optimal aesthetic pouring. Very assertive on citric zest bitterness in the aroma combined with a rare, almost counteractive aged-hop bitter lemon spice make this geuze unique and delicious to me; dry palate, yet with a higher cultured malt residu than the standard puckerers. Almost entry-level and not overly complex, but a sheer and affordable delight, as geuze was in its historical heyday.

Bottle from Ohtsuki. Golden colour, big bubbly white head. Aroma is more vinegary than I expected, grapefruit, bit of funk, mostly sourness. Taste is full on sour, not as much spritziness as expected. Lots of citrus, maybe more lemon than grapefruit, but grapefruit lingering there. Musty. All the usual. Havent had this recently, and whilst it is very nice, its not my favourite gueuze.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 Limpido color oro con un bel cappello di fragile schiuma bianca. Violento aroma acetico e acidulo con sentori seminascosti di luppolo, frutta marcia e fieno... sorprendentemente gradevole! Gusto acido e dolciastro, vinosa e secca come uno spumante brut, emergono note fruttate e leggermente erbacee seguite da un finale asciutto. Corpo lieve, frizzantina, beverina, ottimamente bilanciata: è stata un ottimo digestivo, efficace e dissetante!
UPDATED: MAR 10, 2015 second review/taste. still not the best sour gueuze beer out there, but a very nice one. less carbonated and more wet-wood taste. nice green apple flavors.

Clear amber pour some white head. Smells of acetate, big funk, old yeast, apples, lemons. Tastes of apples, yeast, acid, dust, briny, with some lager hops at the end. Sweeter than other gueuzes Ive had and less acid. Seems like some brettanomyces is helping out moderate the acid. Pleasant lighter than mid carb. Pretty good... still I think I prefer goses when it comes to sours.
Pours a clear golden color, good full head, with good nose. Lots of fruit, with a tart finish. Much less tart on the start than on the finish
Erg zuur biertje waar je van moet houden. Ik hou er wel van. Erg verfrissend en lekker voor in de zomer.
Ruikt zuur. Oogt wel mooi. Smaakt tenenkrommend zuur. Niet mijn type bier. Nooit meer.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2015 Pours a clear golden with a thin white head that receeds into nothingness and leaves minimal lacing. Aroma is barnyard, damp basement and other musty things. Taste is dry, really dry. There is an impression of sweetness but it is immediately sweeped by the tart (but not sour) character of this gueuze. A classic.

Extra from tommy thanks man! Pours Golden amber with lots and lots of head.  Smell is sour, fruity, with a bit of must. Taste is sour up front, crisp and somewhat dry but not as dry as some of the other lambics i have had which I must admit is not very many. Has the right balance of bitterness, and really goes down well, the more this warms the more I am liking it. I think I will need to get more into this style of beer. Good stuff.

Pours hazy golden straw with little white head and minimal lacing. Aroma of funk, lemony, barnyard. Taste had some funk, lemon, light apples, woody, tart but not too sour, very little sweetness. Low body and good carb. One of the best gueuze out there for sure!
375 ml. bottle.  Pours a cloudy gold with a nice white head.  Aroma of tart fruit, funk, and grass.  Taste is apples, lemons, grapefruit, funk, grass, and spice.   Delicious!!

375ml bottle from 2012. Wanted to try this while it was still young after having had a few bottles much older. Pale amber with a nice effervescent biege head. Light funk, a little bit of sourness but not a lot, some candied sugars, some lemon zest, grass. Moderate carbonation, slightly sour, decent body, becomes quite dry, some sugars bit more zest. Think this needs more time so that the sugars can be canibalized ..mmmm

Bottle. Hazy/unclear yellow/light orange with a medium sized diminishing ok lacing head. Sour grapes, leather, whores, no hores no horse, hay, lime, bark/oak, cheese. Not that sour or dry for the style, and seems a bit sweeter than Cantillon and 3 Fonteinen. Very light grapefruit like astringency. Taste is light sweet and sour. Medium body, oily texture, medium/lively carbonation.

2006 bottle, from to brewery to the cellar. Gentle pop, pouring golden orange, plenty of carbonation, firm head. Aroma fruity and barnyard. Tastes sour, very smooth, citrus fruits flavours., little bit of green apple. Great gueuze, fresh as well as with a few years of age, this one is always a winner.
Pours a nice golden orange beer with a for a geuze good white head. Smells typically like a geuze. Taste starts really sour and ends a bit bitter. Dont like the bitter finish.

dense ivory white head that disappears with lacing. slightly viscous pour.  orange copper clear colour. aroma of zest, lemon and barnyard funk. soft complex citrus tart flavour with a bitter aftertaste. dry citrus aftertaste. very soft round mouthfeel and soft carbonation.very good and accessible geuze.  bottle 37.5 cl

Bottle at base camp, Utrecht, during the late nights of post-Borefts fun. Big thanks to Bruce for finally forcing me to drink this consummate classic. Pours cloudy gold with a fine, white foam head. Intense grass in the aroma, some lemon. Great flavor, lots of sharp grass, good balance, light sweetness, some acid burn. Yeah, very fresh with lots of bitter grass and citrus rind. Light to medium bodied with average, massaging carbonation. Moderately dry to finish, quite bitter, with more rindy citrus and fresh grass. Delicious stuff. Ive been drinking for 12 hours and I could drink lots more of this; I couldnt say that about many beers at this point. Super good.

375ml bottle at Hopleaf. Pours dark golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is of sour vinegar, lemons, oak and tons and tons of funkiness. Highly carbonated, almost champange-like.  Taste is very tart; lemons, sour apple, vinegar and oak/wood. Its funky but fairly clean at the same time. The finish is less tart than some other gueuzes but the balance is lovely. Overall, a terrific gueuze. And even better, the experience of drinking this gueuze was greatly enhanced by the fact that the man sitting next to me was sporting a Rollie Fingers mustache...

Bottle. Thanks Tommy! Pours a cloudy light amber with an off white head. Aroma is lemon, apple, pepper, and oak. Taste is complex featuring lemon, apple, barnyard, straw, yeast, pepper, and oak. Medium light body with good carbonation. Nothing sets itself as the stand out quality of the beer - it is extremely well rounded abd balanced. Great Gueuze

Pours into a flute a hazy golden orange with a nice white head that fades to a collar. Aroma is barnyard funk, lemon, tart funky and great. Taste is lemon tartness, barnyard funk, a bit grass, slight sour and dry finish, very refreshing. Nice gueze
Delicatissima in bocca aggressiva al naso, ottima geuze, una delle migliori mai bevute

750 ml bottle from czar, also shared with Albatross and friends. Pours a veiled golden with a thick, bubbly, resilient white head. Aroma is wild yeasts, cheese (???), jungle, rainforest. Flavor is jungle, forest, wild fruits, cheese. Finish is dry as heck, tons of tartness, like having sour candies. Quite possibly the most refreshing beer Ive ever had. Light to medium body, very high carbonation. Very solid!
75cl bottle at a friends house. We are both beer lovers. Dont like it at all. Worst thing Ive ever tasted. Its very sour and tastes like vinegar. We poured it away.

This one poured a murky light orange color with a large white head.  Aroma was light apple vinegar, cheese, wet wood, cobb webs, and cherries.  Flavor was similar, less sour than I was expecting from the aroma, moderately funky, but nothing off putting. Very well rounded lambic.
375 ml bottle. Pours a tawny/copper color with no head. Aromas of wet wood and grapes. Sour/Tart - in a very nice way. Flavors of wood/oak and green grapes. Tasty

A nice but unexceptional gueze and no where near the best non vintage on the market in my opinion. Would rank Boon, hannsens, Cantillon and Tilquin ahead of ti to name but a few.  That is not to say it is not a fine gueze and well priced in Belgium at least.

pours hazy golden with a frothy white head, good retention and lacing. some peaches, apricots and other citrus, pepper, few citric  and very few acetic notes. funk. bright to average carbonation, light body - oily, nice citrusy, spicy peppery finish. good balance!
75 cl bottle from dranken Geers. Hazzay orange , light amber body with white head. Nice sour beer. ***

Bottle. Hazy pale golden colour with minimal white head with short duration. Aroma is light peach, apple and sourish. Flavor has lemon and peach notes with a sourish and light vinegar notes. The final is sour with an average duration.

Pours slightly hazy golden with massive white head. Aroma of not yet ripe apples, green grapes, citrus or maybe orange, some sweet fruit as well, maybe mango? Big initial sourness before it mellows out and a slight balancing sweetness enters. Abrupt finish. Dry mourhfeel, light and somewhat sticky with average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poirs foggy amber with high white head
Aromas of sours apple, grape
Extremely well balanced gueuze. Fresh sour tones of green grapes, citrus, bretta

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at Waterhuis aan de BierkantHazy light orange brown, off-white head. Nice sourness, pretty dry, some dusty cellar notes. Lively carbo.

Last beer consumed at Shawns flat. Weirdly, I havent ever tried this before. I even  cant believe that, but its true. It was a good beer to end a good night. IT WAS.... Greatly bittersweet encompassing sensations of chalkiness, sourdough, lemongrass, aged hops, lemon biscuits, straw stalks, French oak, and peppadew peppers. I shant write anymore; delicious, firm and dry.  Good Gueuze!

375 ml. bottle. Pours orange with a light fizzy white head. Funky, yeasty aroma greets you and if you can get past that, you can enjoy a very refreshing beverage that has a slightly sour finish.

Im normally not into sours, gueuze or lambics, but this one may just have won me over.
Bottle from De Molen shop in Bodegraven. Fruity, funky and sour smell. Similar taset, lightly salty with apples and funk. Nice beer.

My first experience with the only remaining lambic maker whose product I havent tried. 375 mL bottle consumed by myself. Poured into a Teku stemmed glass. I believe this is a 2012 vintage, but dont see a date on the bottle or cork. 

Filling just beyond the bend in my glass creates a tall, frothy, beautiful head. This Gueuze is darker than most, with a glowing, misty orange hue. The appearance is superb, but it is unfortunately the most appreciable characteristic. 

Black Labels aroma is muted, suppressed. Most prominently I note cheesy old hops, lemony acidity, mowed grass, and green apple. Unlike a similar 3F geuze, this brews smell is far more subtle rather than in your face. The subtlety seems to be a lack of complexity more than the touch of refinement. 

Taste is downright watery. The first pass yields more mineral water than anything, and this is followed by Granny Smith apple, navel orange, slight lemon, ruby red grapefruit, and a dry, vinous finish. Oddly, there is a notable, though not overpowering, hop bitterness. With each sip I expect and wait for a rush of flavors that never appear. Im disappointed by the lack of flavor prominence. 

Mouthfeel is on par with most good lambic. Highly effervescent, dry, zippy, tingly, and tannic. 

Overall, I am wondering if I have a bad bottle. Others have rated this much more highly, and Im not that impressed. I would rather buy Tilquin 10 out of 10 times.
Blond colored beer with hardly any head. Sourish nose, dust and salami. Tartness in the mouth, fuity notes.  Dry sourish end.

Aroma: citrus, Brett funk, leather, leaves, oak, bright acidity.  
Appearance: slightly dark golden color, hazy, white head that dissipates fairly quickly.
Flavor: lots of lemon and grapefruit, earthy, oak, funk, some light bready notes, acidity is pleasant but not overpowering, very complex, dry finish.
Palate: light body, carbonation is high.
Overall: great complexity, very enjoyable brew.

375ml bottle from West Lakeview Liquors.  Pours a light amber color with a thin white head.  Aroma is citrus, lemon, grass, hay, a little funk.  Medium on the palate with soft carbonation.  Flavor is lightly sour, but with some sweetness,  yeasty, funky, lemon, with a light sour finish.  Pretty sure this was pretty fresh - bottled in 2013.  I suspect the little bit of sweetness would fade with time.

Light golden yellow with white foam head lacing to glass. Aroma unfolds after the plop when opening the bottle. Apples. Taste initially bit sour, but then unfolds aroma of green unripe sour fruit, apple, pear. Dry. (Velp 201303)
Poured cloudy golden, smelled skunky and hoppy...tastes sour bitter with fruity finish....awesome beer

Bottle. Pours a cloudy light amber with an off white head. Aroma is lemon, apple, pepper, and oak. Taste is complex featuring lemon, apple, barnyard, straw, yeast, pepper, and oak. Medium light body with good carbonation.

375 ml bottle into tulip glass; REF 8x2011 printed on the cork.  Pours fairly cloudy golden amber color with a 2 finger foamy white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers.  Minimal lacing on the glass, with some streaming carbonation.  Aromas of big tart apple, grape, lemon, pepper, grass, hay, leather, oak, clove, white wine vinegar, earth, funk, and earthy spiciness.  Fantastic aromas with huge complexity and nice balance of fruity and spicy notes; a bit more spicy/earthy than most.  Taste of big tart apple, grape, cherry, lemon, grass, hay, pepper, clove, oak, leather, white wine vinegar, earth, funk, and yeast spiciness.  Fair amount of earthy and fruity tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of tart light fruits, grass, hay, pepper, clove, oak, leather, earth, funk, light vinegar, and yeast spiciness on the finish for a bit.  Fantastic balance and complexity of fruity, spicy, and wild yeast notes; near perfect balance of all flavors; and zero cloying flavors present after the finish.  Acidity is also extremely well balanced and not overwhelming at all.  Medium carbonation and body; with a lightly syrupy, acidic, and crisp mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with zero warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is an incredible Gueuze!  Huge complexity and balance of all flavors; and extremely smooth to sip on.  An highly outstanding offering.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 Blind tasting off 18 current available Gueuzes. Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: nice and stable head.
Nose: quite fruity, sourness.
Taste: very complex beer. Sour, sweet and dry.

12.7oz bottle-----> GI stemmed glass.  Pours a hazy dark straw gold with thin white head and good lace.  Smells pretty citrisy with some metal  and moderate funk.  Tastes very tart and funky with some serious barnyard going on.  Palate is lightly fizzy and dry with a great tartness on the back end.  One of the better geuzes Ive had not made by 3Font.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2013 Une gueuze des plus équilibrée.Ses arômes de vieille grange ,de ferme et de surit lui vont a ravirent.Une gorgé  nattend pas l autre.Quel déguste offerte par le snipper de la Slovquie .Merci mon Pat pour se moment de pur plaisir gustatif.

Aroma aspro acidulo con note agrumate, legnose, di paglia bagnata e sentori dolci (miele forse). Dorato-ambrato il colore, con una bella schiuma cremosa. Al palato ingresso fruttato, strutturato su una acidità di fondo che rende la birra secca sul finire. Indubbiamente complessa ma dannatamente equilibrata. Perfetta come aperitivo da sorseggiare. Vale la pena provarla.

Bright peach colour with big foamy head. Aroma is lemon citric, wet sock. Taste is peppery tartness, big bodied, creamy and sour. Sensation on mouth is like fizzy sherbert. Palate is lingering tart like a resinous IPA. Overall, lovely gueze, but missing some complexity of the greats.

Bottle, 2012 ed. Pour is lightly hazy gold, white head. Very good retention for lambic. Aroma is funk, barrel, lemon, citrus, dust. Taste is moderately lactic, oak, lemon, dusty, citrus. Palate is soft, slick, sour finish. Outstanding.

Bottle from Phillycraft. Pours hazy orangish copper with golden tints and small white head. Aromas of horse blanket, some funk, tartness, lemon citrus. Flavors of lemon, dusty malts, barnyard, and a nice acidic tartness. Really nice body and carbonation. Classic gueuze.

Bottle. Pours a darker copper color with a moderate fizzy white head. Nose has hints of citrus and acidity, but isnt overpowering. Taste is just a tad sour and is nice and dry. Feels very smooth. Good drink.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2013 27/I/13 - 2 x 37,5cl bottle @ home, paired with mussels in witbier and fries, a classic! (2013-105) 
Clear deep orange beer, aery off-white head, falls down fast to a more stable fine off-white layer of bubbles, bit adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: typical bretta, some citrus, oranges, dusty, pretty fruity in general. MF: good carbon, medium body. Taste: soft mellow sourness, citric acidity, ripe melons, green apples, bit spicy, peppery. Aftertaste: citric acidity, touch of vinegar, sour apple skin, bit spicy. Really one of my all-time favourite geuzes, probably the reason it took me so long to rate it.

Bottle. Hazy light hay liquid with medium white head. Aroma of barnyard, lemons, wheat, apples, mango and fruit brett. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of lemons, barnyard and apples. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Awesome, very fresh and funky.
Bottle. Pours cloudy light orange with high head that gradually torn itself. Aroma is lambic basement, hint of maize and wheat. Flavor is sour with some sweet tones, malty with a hint of dried hops.
Hazy golden blond coloured beer with small whtie head and only few carbonation visible. Sourish fruity aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is rather sour dry.

Kaatuu Girardinin omaan lasiin vaaleanruskeana ja läpinäkymättömänä, vaahtoa on jonkin verran, mutta se katoaa nopeasti. Haju on todella hapan ja jopa käyneen hajuinen, joka on pääroolissa. Maku on hapan, jopa hieman pilaantuneen makuinen aluksi, mutta läpi alkaa puskemaan hedelmää ja se tasoittuu. Suutuntumasta ei muistiinpanoja ollut. Kaiken kaikkiaan todella jännä makuelämys, josta geuzemaiseen tapaan rupesi pullon ensimmäisen neljänneksen jälkeen nauttimaan kovasti ja loppu oli todella hyvä.

Pours opaque orange with a small white head. Smells funky and a little sour. Taste is sour with a touch of funk. Light-to-medium bodied with a wet texture and mostly soft mouth-carbonation, Girardin Gueuze Black Label finishes with a subtle kiss of sourness.

Bottle from Etre Gourmet. Pours hazy golden with a huge rocky white head. Aroma of fresh yeasted apples. Fizzy mouthfeel. Taste is light sour & fresh apples, barnyard and horseblanket, short and dry aftertaste.

2012 bottle thats been sitting around for a few months. Cork comes out readily. The aroma of this beer is an experience on its own - apple, hay, lemon rind, and a pronounced herbal funk (including some lightstruck character). Deep gold in color with a slight haze. This particular bottle was unusual because it raised a substantial head of foam that lasted. Taste follows the aroma with a nicely balanced acidity. Apple peel, lemon rind, grain, hay, and an intriguing funk. A fantastic balance of each individual character. Prickly carbonation. Mouthfeel is appropriately dry and champagne-like. Possibly not the most "challenging" gueuze, but probably my favorite for its balance of funk, fruit, and acid.

Bottle at JF tasting, from Noel Cuveliers - 29/12/12.
Very dark amber with no head.
Nose is sour, tarte, lemon, wood, a little smoke, crisp dried out apples.
Taste follows, burnt citrus notes, wood, sour/tarte fruits.
Medium in body with light spritzy carbonation, tarte finish causing the lip to pucker a touch!
Excellent stuff!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Slightly hazy orange pour with a thin head.  Aroma is slightly sour.  Some glue in there.  Taste is tart with apples.  Mouth tingles a bit from the carbonation, but is overall nice and refreshing.  By far this is the best Gueuze Ive had.  Very refreshing.

Bottle. Light orange, hazy. Quite intensive nose. A lot of barnyard, brett funk, hay, a bit of hops, sour orange. Some yeast, wheat. Body is acidic, flavourful. Sour citrus, hay, hops. Long. Very nice geuze. Acidic, sharp, intensive.-- bb/h

Pointed the bottle away from me, released the cage, waited a few seconds...hen the cork shot out like a rocket in a fantastic parabola on the Florida beach. This is the life. How many guezes have I had today? 

The beer is slightly hazy, appearing a light orange hue. The head is over an inch thick, and leaves a nice sheet of lacing on the glass. 

The aroma offers citrus, funk, oak, the usual suspects.

Really easy to drink, hard not to guzzle. Masterfully blended. Citrus flavors sneak in and out among ever-present oak and funk presence. Delicious.

Slight pucker, masked alcohol, easy to drink. Great feel.

Overall, a terrific beer well deserving of its high rating.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-25-2011

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2015 Bottle, 2010.  Autolysis.  Re-rate:
Bottle at Le Bier Circus. Clear yellow pour with a white head. Barnyard bouquet. Tart with wet hay and horse blanket highlights. Lemon zest and citrus backbeats. Good body and mouthfeel.

Bottle. Golden body. Short, fizzy, white head, mostly diminishing. Aroma of barnyard, wood, toasted grain, light vinegar, lemon, flowers. the flavor is moderately sweet and moderately and heavily acidic. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and moderately acidic. Medium body, smooth texture and lively carbonation. Dry finish, leaving tastes of wood, must, herbs, melon, sour strawberry.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ One finger foamhead. Stale fruity basement notes. Hints of citrus. Sour dryness. Long fresh finish. Great long lasting brew.

Clear, dark golden color. Big white foamy head that dies a bit slow and leaves plenty of lacing. Nice honey aroma with a bit of funk underneath. Straw and some fruit mixed in as well. Very tart up front with a spicy funkiness in the back. Sweet, yet sour. A bit of a salty character. Nice and tart in the back. A bit dry, yet very nice.
Shared from a 37,5  cl bottle at home.  Pours a cloudy gold with a thick white head - fairly long lasting leaving some lacing.  Sour funky aroma.  Crisp sour apple and lemon. Refreshing tart finish.
a nice geuze! better with some years of aging! some gentle vanilla notes after 5+ years! keep it it will only get better!

Bottle from etre gourmet.

A good geuze nice taste nice sourness. Would drink again.

Bottled. Pours deep golden with a big off-white head. Vinous nose of sour apples, citrus and wood. Dry flavor with again fruit and vanilla and a tart finish. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and average CO2. An excellent gueuze.

blonde, amber, small and steady foam. smells very little, sour,
tastes sour and dry, no aftertase. good, drinkable beer

Bottle back at base camp, Utrecht. I cant  believe I hadnt rated this yet! The pours a hazy deep gold color with a medium white head. The nose is super-fresh lemon squash, musty basement, cobweb and expressive yeasty white grape skin. The taste is bright, clean lemon. Mildly acetic. Soft marshmallow sweetness. Bright and funky. The bodys light and refreshing. Overall, one of the best. For the price and availability, probably only Orval challenges Black Label.
Bottled, thx Rlgk. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Smells spicy, sour and abit fruity. Tastes sour, creamy dry bitter with similar finish.
Had some of this. Err, fizzy, lemony, rotten stuff frankly. Had it in Bruge. Had a cork. ...er, how many characters have I still got to fill in this description before itll accept it?
UPDATED: OCT 19, 2012 160512 @ Århus Syd tasting: Extreme bandit, with the taste of burnt rubber and stable (or burnt PCB). Very challenging sour beer with lots of acid.

Zythos 2008. Poured cloudy yellow with minimal head after it died down. Traditional tart, acidic sweet aroma. Lively smooth mouthfeel, flavour of aidic sweet sourness. Wonderful dry, lingering aftertaste.
Bottle. Golden orange with small white head. Aroma barnyard, horsecarpet. Taste sour and fresh. I don´t think there´s anything wrong with this beer, I just don´t like gueuze.

Bottle.  Poured straw with a medium-sized white head.  Aroma was grass, tart, green apples, citrus.  Flavor was moderate to high sourness, moderate bitterness.  Lots of wood, citrus.  High acidity.  The funk was relatively restrained, almost clean.  Highly effervescent.  A very dignified gueuze.  Absolutely stellar.

Bottle (375 ml) from bieresgourmet.be. Hazy orange amber, medium white head. Very fresh green apple and grapefruit aroma, some leather and wood. Light to medium bodied, high carbonation. Very dry with strong acidity and some peel bitterness.

Bottle. Pours hazy amber with a small off-white head that dissipates quickly but laces well. Aroma is yeast, tart citrus, white wine, wood, funk. Flavor same, medium sour with a sour lingering finish. Very nice gueuze.

Pours hazy yellow with a medium head. Aroma is dry apples and vinegar. Flavor is sour malts, apples and vinegar with a very fruity finish. Not my style

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Enjoyed this one a lot....pours with a big head and a lot of white lacing white alows a very funky (almost wet feet) aroma.  Palate is sour with some apple, very tart, very dry and quite drinkable.  Very good example of the style.

Thanks Huhzubendah!

Pours a copper straw color with a nice off white head.  Very cloudy in appearance.  Nose is a mild lemon, sweaty shirt, and an earthy dirt vibe.  Taste is the same, with bitterness coming through.  Sour and earthy as well.  Feel is malty, and thick for a gueze.  Great beer, and one I'd definitely enjoy again.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad

Bottle. Thanks to KyotoLefty. Great stinky, sweaty aroma, dried sod, a field of turned up grass. Dark gold color, fine lacing. Initial has the sourest hit imaginable; mid palate goes sour-bitter in subtle lemony push; finish is so dry and smooth. Thin-medium body; very crisp and refreshing. A sensory tongue twister. Great stuff!

375ml bottle. Some sweet, tart and dms aromas. Pours hazy golden with nice white head, good retemption, some lacing. Light body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is really sour, tart, with some fruity hints. Quite balanced (considering the style...) and really enjoyable.

A truly great Lambic Gueuze and a wonderful introduction to this fascinating style. Refreshingly sour (but not too sour compared to a few other Lambics).
A very fruity nose and a long after taste. My favorite beer for this unique style.

Bottle shared with esp0r and edvard at Amundsen, august 18th 2012.

Hazy light amber color, small white head. Complex fruity aroma of apples, grain, yeast. Sour taste of apples and lemon, wood, grassy. Very high carbonation, a really enjoyable beer.
Bottle with Ben. A tidy Geuze. Lots of typical funky yeast and fresh lemon bitterness. Quite mild comparitively but a real pleasure to drink.

Bottle in preparation for cgarvieuk tasting. Golden with well held white head. Typical lambic aroma, funky with fresh lemons and ripe fruit. Similar taste with a well balanced sweetness and mildly tart finish. Very nice

Bottle shared with daje and ed at Amundsen
Straw yellow hazy, white head. Smells of funk and barnyard, some malts. Taste is light sweet, nice medium sour and with nice lactic and fruity tones. Some tart apples as well. Quite dry palate and lively carbonation. Very nice stuff

A hazed amber gueuze with a thick frothy white head. In aroma, a nice epsom salt, ground cherries, white pepper and musty Brett. In mouth, a smooth peppery epsom salt with sour grapefruits, Brett, nice and refreshing. Tasted mid June 2012.

12.7oz bottle at the Flying Saucer in Little Rock, AR. Pours a hazed orange colored body with a finger-width, dense and frothy, off-white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing throughout. Aroma is really nice with a slightly acidic sourness, dry wood, a moderate barnyard funk, lemon-pepper, apple, and a touch of pale malt. Flavor is similar. Somewhat funky with lots of dry wood up front. Nice sour notes with a tart grapefruit and lemon in the middle with some apples, a light pepper, bitter citrus peels, a floral touch, and a touch of pale malt. Finishes very dry and woody with a nice citrus tartness, touch of spice, and clean funk. Lengthy aftertaste following a medium body and a lively carbonation. Overall, a very nice gueuze. Dry and woody with a nice mix of funk and sour citrus. Easy drinking with a nice carbonation and very enjoyable all-around. Great beer.

Bottle @ home. Clear yellow color, medium sized  fizzy white head thats gone before you know it. Smell sour, tart, rubber. Taste is superbly balanced, only lightly sour, not sharp at all. Very nice long lasting finish. Gotta be one of the best geuzes Ive ever had.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy gold with a small white head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is Bandaids and funk. Thin mouthfeel with a sour fruit and light tart finish. Easy to drink a very impressive gueuze from Girardin.

Bottle shared by Arve_Christian - Thanks! Pours deep golden with a white head. Acidic aroma with barnyard, fruit, citrus, malt and hints of spices and wood. Fruity with a delicious souness and acidity. Deliciously refreshing - a very nice gueuze! (2012-07-27)

Sample from the bottle, shared by Jay. Nice thin white head, leaving little lace. Hazy orange color. Very awesome texture. Light, fine smooth carbonation, dry finish. Refreshing and bright. Good, light tart taste. Very interesting, unique aroma - something floral, maybe some kind of spice I cant pinpoint. Wood, flowers, peppercorns.. Hard to say. I dont know enough about geuze yet to appreciate all the subtleties, but I can tell this is a good one for sure. At least, significantly better than the ones Ive had before it. Would recommend; would revisit.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2012 2000 vtg Bottle (#548). Pours cloudy orange with white small head, not much lace. Aromas of basement, sandalwood, haze, and spice. Taste is peppery, musky, and wooded the fuck out. Other notes of apple, cheese, and blood orange zest. Complex and perfectly dry finish. re-rate 99 vtg, even more musk basement flood notes with some shelfish beach.

On 37,5 cl bottle.
Golden color, ok foam.
Intense stable aromas
Medium body & full complexity.
Good sourness. Medium carbonation & good balance
Very enjoyable

A - Clear orange slight haze, fizzy head that lasted less than a minute and left almost no lacing.

S - Hits you the moment the cork bursts out of the bottle. Sour funky dryness that I can feel in the back of my throat. Citrus peels and the smell of an apple orchard with young sour apples and the dry grass of autumn.

T - Sharp quick and sour right as it hits my mouth. This one has quite a zip right at the beginning. In the middle, I get some citrus peels and immature apples where the peels add a good amount of dryness. then a slightly bitter finish on the back of the tongue. Very clean aftertaste, a bit of bitter grapefruit is left in the mouth but not for long.

M - Leaves the mouth clean and dry. Very fizzy and light bodied. A bit gassier than I generally like but this makes it a fantastic palette cleanser that works out well as an aperitifs or between courses. Gave me a nice but mild mouth sweat.

D - Refreshing and easy to drink. Low alcohol (5%) gives you the option of drinking a couple and feeling fine.

Cloudy orange color with a quickly disappearing head. The nose is loaded with Brett and varied yeasts as well as some key like. Medium bodied with high intensity and acidity. Lithe and nimble with layered tart fruit and a pillow soft mouthfeel.
Smells promising. Tastes zesty, funky, satisfying. Wonderful carbonation. Superb example of the style.
Cloudy apricot color, sparse white head that fades.  Aromas of lemon, wheat, and oak.  Lemon, wheat, chemical flavors, fizzy light head.  Fine beers, easy drinking Gueuze.
A near perfect gueuze for me, striking a wonderful balance between sour, dry, hop, sweet, citrus, funk.  Beautiful pour, handsome bottle, fresh aromas and long in the mouth.  Great.
Bärnstensfärgad beslöjad öl med vitt skum. Klassisk surölsdoft. Jäst, funkighet surhet med dragning åt vinäger. Samma i smaken. Elegant torr munkänsla.

Pours deep orange. Head is large and fluffy. Nose is very complex with notes of funk, tartness, cheese, fruits, peppery spices, farmhouse complexities. Flavor is smooth but moderately sour some some funk but other nuances fade to the sour. Clean finish. really nice beer.
375ml bottle.  Pours a hazy dark orange with a small head.  Aroma is subtle, sharp sweet lemon with a little funk.  Taste is sour lemon to start.  Very sour finish with barnyard funk.  Bone dry.

375ml (12.7 oz.) bottle poured into a tulip glass.

Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a two and half finger pillowy white head. Apple, pear, citrus,and vinegar with oak accents on the nose. An opening salvo of tartness fills the mouth. Luscious citrus and other fruit tones, sourdough-like yeasty esters and funk dominate the midpalate, finishes tart and dry. Perfect level of carbonation, smooth and clean mouthfeel. This gueze reaches a level most others fall well short of. Among the very best.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours dark golden/orange with good white head. Very nice lacing. Aroma is of barnyard, funk. Taste is of sourness, barnyard, horseblanket, funk, acid, citrus (grapefruits), sweet. Overall: Nice carbonation. Well balanced.

Bottle poured a cloudy orange, amber color, aromas of funk, must, cardboard, light funky citrus fruit, and some light vinegar.  Flavors are the same, interesting lambic/gueuze, tart, vinegary, and some leathery fruit.

Everyone raves about girardin being the best value compared to other bottles. Thinking back, surprised I havent had one before. Now I know why. Doesnt do it for me, huge phenolic, very dirty, funk. Not my style of geuze. But all geuze is still good in its own way so...

Pours hazy gold/pale orange. BIG fluffy head. Nice sweet//earthy balanced aroma with a bit of sour nose that hints at the taste. Hits the tongue puckeringly sour but gives way to smooth farmhouse/earthy oak flavor. Everything sits on the tongue for a bit. All around great, especially in this heat wave!

cork says 2011. pours hazy golden with a hint of dull brown. next to zero head. not much pop from the cork. lots of deep funk and sour lemon with a subtle skunky scent to it. a hint of dry oak. im really digging the smell. bit of sweet light lemon up front. quite smooth. sourness kicks in, although that too is a bit smooth. dry oak and funk through out the finish with a slightly more sour flavor. very smooth and mellow, almost non blended lambic like. very tame carbonation. this was good, great flavor. i cannot wait to see what my other bottle does with some time on it.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2014 Pours a hazy orange, active carbonation leading to a pillowy 4 finger head.  Aromas of cheese, slight citrus, sunshine warmth.  Taste is silky smooth, tart but not really funky, very dry.  Finishes with a pepper note.  Very nice.  Not overly sour but very balanced and smooth.  Very, very good.  Perhaps the best geuze Ive ever had.  This is truly a world class beer.  Amazing.

Tasted Blind at a tasting party in Gent.

A - Half finger yellow head. Fades fast. Orange cloudy hazy

S - great wood scent. Oude for sure. Very old. Slight bit of cleaning detergent. Sea salt. Walnuts?

T - salty and vinegar filled. Chlorine finish. Slight cedar taste. Copper? This beer is all over

M -  90/10 carb. Cant be old. Heavy body. Very ripe grape aftertaste and slight metallic

O - 65/100 pretty. Smells bad tastes okay. Metallic is a big turn off.



NOTE: Had this at a tasting group. Most agreed that this was a very YOUNG bottle and thus was opened to early (2 months after bottling). I have one in my cellar that Ill open and Ill re-rate this in a few months maybe around December 12.
29th October 2009Kulminator on the Borefts 1 trip. Hazy gold beer. Light sour nose. Sourish but also woody and with something else going on I cant pin down. Nice Lambic - very drinkable.

(37,5 cl bottle from Toft Vin) Pours a clear amber with frothy, off-white head and fizzy carbonation. Aroma is tart with odours that are rather unfamiliar to me: Apple, urinal and wood. Medium body, oily texture with a sour finish. Taste is sour and has cidery notes of apple, vinegar and wood although theyre more dry and sharp than in most ciders Ive tasted - probably due to the dryness and lack of sugar. Interesting, refreshing and not unpleasant but I have the feeling it will still be a few years before I truly appreciate this style. The memories of butyric acid from inferior brews still haunt my associative memory.
@ Convent Santa Clara, Middelburg. Excellent Geuze. More sour than bitter, thats how a geuze should be.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2016 (28 may 2012 rating)
One of my two favorite geuzes. Beautiful amber with a medium sized soapy head. Smells like grape fruit, vinegar and stable. Taste like gooseberry, white wine and different citrus fruits. Really really nice and balanced despite lots of nice sourness.

Rerate, 6. sep. 2016
Still one of my favorites. Always lots of green apples, balanced sourness, just balance, complexity and awesomeness. This beer works so amazing with a couple of years of aging.

375ml bottle. Pours out a hazy orange with one finger of foam. Big funky notes from the moment the bottle is uncorked, but I soon discovered that the magic will really happen in the mouth. Having dabbled in gueuze before without quite appreciating it, this was the moment where it all seemed to click. The oak and lemon characteristics shine through while the sourness is mouth-watering without being overbearing. Really special.
This is an outstanding gueuze! Its well balanced taste makes it easily drinkable, espeially for a sour beer. Would recommand for anyone who likes this style!

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2015 Multiple 375 ml & 750 ml over time. Both fresh and aged.

Appearance: Bright golden/orange with lot of small bubbles, a frothy off-white head that diminishes to leave a small fully lasting head and little lacing.

Aroma: Barnyard, green apples, light peppery notes, citric presence, brettanomyces, leather, hay and lemon... so much complexity, but yet so smooth and well balanced.

Taste: Moderate acidity for the style, but still plenty of barnyard as well as green apples (not in a bad way), grapefruits/grapefruit bitterness, brettanomyces, oak and citric notes.

Palate: Light to medium body, but never watery. Lively carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel, a tad oaky especially when fresh. Dry finish.   

Overall: My "everyday" gueuze. Not because its not complex, but only because its cheap, easy to find, not too hyped and damn delicious! The balance is nearly perfect. Its a great gueuze right of the gate, but it can age gracefully as well and doesnt become acetic. Very complex, but still super drinkable/quenching. A true masterpiece!

2012 bottle. Massive pop of a cork! Slightly hazy deep gold color with a foamy white head that laces. Aroma of tart lemon, light grain, stinky cheese, and yeasty funkiness. Flavor isnt that sour as it is tart and funky. Yeasty leather and lemon. Finishes dry. Delicious beer.

Sampled from 0.375l bottle @ Ølfestival København 2012. A blurry copper beer with a soft and kind sidesticking off-white head. It has a light tart and acidic aroma with some lemons and wood immediately. Actually quite nice. Not to sour at all in flavor! Was expecting a heavy tart and super sour gueuze. Really mild and kind. Light woody flavors, a good amount of citrusy lemons. Surprised over this. Not what I had pictured in my head, and that can often be a bad thing. This time however, I quite liked it! 10.05.2012

Tasted @ Gastropub Tuulensuu geuze blind tasting 2012. #5/15 overall rating
Pours darkish orange with a tiny head. Different aroma compared to the other geuzes, some tart fruits and herbal notes. Taste is smooth with some slightly tart fruits, berries and slight herbal notes. Finish is tart, slightly smooth with some sourness. Well balanced.

What a wonderful surprise to pick a beer like this up off the shelf in a grocery store. I loved the mild funk I got to this while still being totally palatable. I am very happy I picked up a few bottles of this when I could!
Bottle to snifter. Looks fine; copper. Smells nice and funky. Tastes pretty good too with a nice feel on the palate. Good geuze, but not great.

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with minimal white head. Complex rustic aroma -  barnyard or basement, vinegar. Very sour taste pleasantly accompanied by some sweetness. Medium body, lively carbonation with dry finish. Very nice.

yellow gold, soft fog, no foam, just sparkling.
 sour taste good, refreshes the mouth and the spirit. recalls the finale of champagne. intense taste of fruit, lemon and citrus. for thrill seekers

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2016 Bottle: Not sure which vintage:
Thicker, lively and quicker disappearing small to medium off white head on top of a hazy and bit brighter orange colored beer than the white label version.
Smell fruit, yeast, malts, some soap, hint of caramel (way less than the white label version), wild yeast, hint of something light woody, bit crispy and a hint of something ligh light candy sweet.
Taste is more sour than the white label version. Also a good amount of elder hops, hint of barley malts, old flowers, wild yeast, , more bitterness than the white label version, some wood (which comes more forward in the aftertaste), bit sharper in grains though soft in mouthfeel and texture, less rounder than the white label version, hint of fruit like grape, 
Aftertaste is more malty and sour than the white label version, also some wild yeast, elder hops and herbs like grass.
Low to medium carbo, soft mouthfeel, fuller body and a light creamy texture.
Really good too but I liked the white label version a little bite more.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: bottle 2002 vintage. Pours hazy orange, no head. Aroma: Dusty, brett, horseblanket, stable, musty, cardboard, acetone, nail polish remover, oxidized, green apples, vinegar, grains, leathery, grapefruit, grapefruit peel, Taste: tart green apples, bret, dusty, dry, lemon, citrussy, medium to low carbonation, grape fruit peel, woody, acetone, acidic, funky, stable, rural (rasmusott)

Bevuta in bottiglia. Color giallo oro con schiuma bianca, abbondante di grana fine. Al naso sentori di limone e frutta, in bocca citrica con effetto spumantizzato. E la mia prima birra "acida", secondo me ottima anche se non ho le conoscenze per giudicarla.

Dec 2009 and my taste buds havent changed a great deal: Green cork and caged 37.5 cl bottle, poured very carefully into my huge Judas stemmed tulip glass.

Only a very small amount of sediment left the bottle, so the beer wasnt too cloudy or misty, a dirty old gold is the best colour discription I can come up with. An off-white head sat uneasily on top, looking like it wanted to be somewhere else. Masses of bubbles travelled upwards to join the unhappy foaming head.

Rotten cooking apples and pickling vinegar with a sour-puss smell. A cows farmyard that hasnt been hosed down for three weeks, even though the cows have used it twice daily to deliver calves.

Vingarous to a fault, this is one sour beer. Uncooked cooking apples mixed with cow dung came to mind. Ive tried to embrace this style and have even enjoyed a couple over the years, but I really struggled with this one. I can truely see why this type of beer isnt drank in Belgium very often and the style is slowly dying.

I had to have olives, various cheeses and crackers to help me finish off this bottle. God knows what my arse will smell like tomorrow, my intestines were complaining after the second sip.

This reminded me of an old rough scrumpy style cider that a farmhand with a few loose marbles might try and drink to help his teeth rot and scramble his brain even more.

I have tried to score for the style, not my personnal view, otherwise it would have got a few minus numbers!
Bottle. Cloudy gold, white head. Barnyard, lemon grapefruit citrus, the mythical horse blanket note. The go-to, introductory gueuze.

Pours a golden color with a thick white head that lasts for ever, seriously.  The aroma is some malt sweetness, sour tart citrus, slight cotton candy. A touch of sweetness from the malt hits my tongue then the sour takes over. Funk, citrus going to dry ending with grapefruit and some spice. Light body with active yet smooth carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2014 Bottles and on tap many times - pours a hazy golden orange with a medium white head. Nose brings out lovely horse blanket and barnyard funk. Flavour brings out a huge barnyard funky kick, horse blanket, and a light citrusy fruit component. Just one of the best not-too-rare gueuzes out there. Wonderful.
Bottle sample at the 3rd Israeli Sour Tasting. Thanks Lee.  Pours orange-blond and cloudy, piss and garlic aroma. Hardcore sour taste, burning, green olives. Flat, medium body, long, sweetish finish.

Pours a clear golden amber with a small white fizz. Aroma citric and funky with a lot of minerally bandaid in a good way. There is a slight underlying sweetness as well. Flavor is wonderfully sour and pungent. Lots of great lambic character. Excellent beer.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2012 Ruikt vooral zurig, citrus. Beetje gras/hooi? Smaakt voor een gueuze nogal keurig in balans. Citrus, fris, trekt van behoorlijk zuur naar droogbitter weg om weer met minder zuur citrus te eindigen. Beetje of je de structuur van peer proeft.Deftige, sjieke, hele goeie gueuze. Niet zo wild en onbezonnen als andere goeie gueuzes.

Bottle shared by Kyle. Pours a hazy gold with a slight red hue and an off white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of horse blanket and funk with backing tart fruit. Flavor begins tart fruit but is joined by a nice funk note of horse blanket.

Pour deep and unclear orange, with a small white head. 
Aroma of lemon, grapefruit, and slight peach?
Taste is fresh and sour, with s slight bitter finish. 
Average body, with a fizzy carb.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a white wine glass.  Pours transparent golden with small bright white head.  Little lacing, medium body, medium carbonation, and sour aroma.  Taste is some sweet citrus, sour funk, hint of bitterness, and a hint of spice.  Pretty good.

Funky farm house aroma.  Grapefruit and musty flavors.  Deep gold in color with head that settles off.

Notes: 10 Zythos

Bottle. Pours clear gold/copper with medium, fizzy white head; good retention and some lacing. Aroma is sour fruit, wheat, sweet malt, and spice. Flavor is sweet malt forward with dominate sour fruit; crisp finish. Light body and warmth with medium carbonation.

Poured from a bottle into a stunted goblet. Beer is yellow and mostly clear, there are a few floaties in there but it looks fine. Forms a thin head and there is no lacing. Head falls away, carbonation is mild and not very steady.

Aroma is lemony and funky. Lots of citric sour in there. The funk comes up a little later, smells like a sour bomb.

I gave a sip of this beer to a friend who has never had a guezue and she described it as piss flavored candy. Its a great beer though. Bright, sour, finishes tart, slightly dry but doesnt dry the mouth out. A slight funk on the backend, medium to low bodied. An overall really good gueuze and a good beer.

Serving type: bottle

Pours orange with a small white head. Nose is lemons, grass and funk. Taste is sweet sour and bitter all at the same time but sour is what dominates the finish. Mouthfeel is extremely fizzy and crisp. Long sour aftertaste. Delish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Orange golden colour, small white head. Aroma of malts, citrus, quite fruity, straw, oak, light mint notes when young. Flavour pleasantly tart, light residual sweetness, lemon acids, light oak astringency. Good mouthfeel, lively carbonation -geuze is called the champagne of the north for a reason- and tart, fruity finish.
Black Girardin has always been one of my overall favourite guezes. Its friendly and nicely drinkable, suitable for almost all occasions.
(From 37,5 cL bottle @ Café Jos)

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2012 Bottle on New Years Eve 2012, Bottle drunk after a couple of top Champagnes and I have to say this beat them both. Pours cloudy golden orange amber, white head. Nose is green appley, cooking apples, strong sour yeasty, toasted French bread, farmyard, grain husk, burnt caramel, urine . Taste is very green appley, Bramley apples, sour yeast , very light and citrous acidic, vinegary, grassy, toasted white bread. Outstanding beer.

Thanks Nick for sharing.  Pours a clear, golden yellow with loads of carbonation.  Aroma is stale grain, slight fruitiness and grain.  Taste is slightly tarte with sourness and good backing taste that carries it through.
Not sure how much more perfect a beer could be. Up front sour backed with some straw. Big carbonation and foamy in the mouth. Thanks Nick!

Cloudy amber pour thin white head was well carbonated on opening .... .aroma of barnyard, lemon, caramel malts .... taste is of lemons, caramel malts, light candi syrup, barnyard ... finishes dry bitter and of lemon rinds
Very nice geuze looks great the colour is good  and a fine sourness. Yes something you must drink often.

Bottle, courtesy of yngwie. Pours golden with an off-white head. Aroma of  funk, lemon, leather and malt. Flavor is sour and woody with some lemon, acid, leather and oak. Medium body, lively carbonation. Really nice .

37,5 cl. bottle, cork flew off with a huge bang, cork says 2011. Some of the content went down in my pot to make moules frites. Poured in a flute. Hazy, light orange/amber colour, with a medium sized  white, frothy head. Aroma with flowers, lemon, corn, earth, barnyard, yeasts and some very faint hops. Taste is lightly sweet at first, but quickly turns heavily sour. Notes of apple cider, vinegar, pine, grass and citrus. Medium body, medium carbonation, medium length finish. Excellent beer
Gueuze molt ben feta. Ideal per començar una bona cata o per netejar la boca després duna BD XI. Imprescindible.

375ml bottle poured into a tulip.

Appearance is a hazy medium orange with a fluffy one finger head. Lots of carbonation and great head retention.

Aroma of orange and lemon with really only a slight hint of funk. Some wet hay and barnyard but it is not overpowering. There is a bit of yeastiness as well.

The funk comes through a little more on the taste but once again it is restrained compared to other examples of this style. Lemony lime citrus is much more prominent and there is some pear as well. I think I can even taste a little bit of caramel. Quite a bit of tartness is present leading to an incredibly crisp, dry finish.

This is my new favorite gueuze. It is perfectly balanced with the citrus, funk, and sourness all in balance. While I tend to like extremely funky brews it is nice to experience a good balance. A top notch brew.
Pours hazy yellow with a medium head. Aroma is dry apples and vinegar. Flavor is sour malts, apples and vinegar with a very fruity finish. Good stuff.

bread, caramel, nuts, floral, grass, herbs, basement aromas, barnyard, leather, cooked vegetables, banana, bubblegum, skunky, ginger, woody, light sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, orange, sparkling, minimal head, full body, creamy, lively, long finish,

375ml bottle.  Cork labeled Ref A x 2010

This is one of those perfect examples of a beer considered world class that I overlook at the local store every time I walk in.  Time to make up for lost time and dive in.

Pour is bright, slightly hazy golden amber with some yeast chunks collecting around the bottom.  The white head is fizzy and short-lived with plenty of bubbles streaming to the top.

Aroma is wonderfully complex with all kinds of things going on.  There is the slightly tart green apple and pear sweetness but with a musty, wet hay thing going on in addition to some acetic acid.

Taste has an initial mouth-puckering tartness with lemons and green apples but also with a hefty bretty funk thrown in.  There is some dry oak in the finish and the tartness and acid linger on the palate for a long time.

The mouthfeel is crisp, clean and dry with lots of tingling tartness on the tongue.

Again, I feel a little ashamed that I walk by these all the time in the search for something new and exotic.  In terms of gueuzes, this is excellent, and certainly one of the top few beers regularly on shelf here.  Will not be passing by this as frequently....

14/05/2011 Les Vignerons (375ml bottle). Ambrata densa, abbastanza limpida, solo appena torbida a causa dei lieviti (minima traccia), con schiuma lieve ma molto persistente. Al naso risalta un odore selvatico, acido, enterico, tipico di stalla. In bocca è complessa, aspra, agrumata, acida, secca, asciutta e pulita, con note balsamiche sul finale. Corpo medio, frizzante, rinfrescante. Molto buona e gradevole, nel complesso risulta tra le migliori e più genuine gueuze in assoluto.

[Rated 06/03/2010] Pours light amber color with thin white head. It has the distinctive sour aroma and flavor with a bit of grapefruit bitterness. Leaves  lasting sour apple finish. I have yet to develop a taste of lambics, but this one is very flavorful -- yeasty, fruity and not too bitter.

Bottle shared by mattyb83 pours a golden/orage woth a large white head. Aroma is funky brett, lemon, dough, and pepper. Taste similar to aroma, citrus, acidic, tart, with some leather and wet wood. Really enjoyable.

375 ml bottle.
Originally rated on 20100726. (7+3+8+4+15)
Pours clear copper colour with medium white head. Aroma of sour grapes, ripe fruits, yeast, earth and barnyard notes, mild rose hip and leaves. Flavour of sour and ripe fruits, earth, herbs, grapes and mild citrus. Very sour palate with a mouth-drying finish. Nice and long sour aftertaste.
3465
Bottle.  Pours a hazy gold with a small, off-white head.  Sour citrus aroma with notes of wood and earth.  Great sour flavor with more citrus, wood and earthy notes.  Nice sour, citric finish.

Beautiful hazy copper color, taste of granny smith apples tart and obviously sour.  As it sits grapefruit flavors come out. Pours with tight white head. Grassy aroma very light barn. This is a very good beer.

Bouteille de 750ml bouche de liège. Bue après létiquette blanche. Dorée cette bière est plus pâle que la blanche, la mousse est blanche et elle pétille beaucoup, effervescence est marquée. Le nez est acide avec beaucoup deffluves sauvages. La bouche est classique, funky, très acide et piquante. Un classique. 8/10

I finally take the pleasure of rating this after loving it ever since I got into lambics. Cork says Ex2012. Holy smokes, this is a beautiful beer! Pours light copperish amber with a huge and tight bubbled white head. Just gorgeous. Aroma is more funky than I remeber other bottles - brettanomyces and wild yeast just all over the place. But it also has the most lovely and very signature Girardin gooseberry/grape fruit tarty fruitiness that trademarks this gueuze to me. Eventually strong lactic acidity along with a rural hay-ish farmhouse touch. Magnificent! The taste is of course tart and gueuzy as always - but the tartness is so elegant and well balanced - matched by nothing Ive had this far (well, I admit that I havent had many). Definitely on the more fruity side compared to Cantillon, 3F etc, but the funkiness suffices and creates a harmonious balance. I dunno if this is just a moment of zen, but right now, I want to drink this and nothing else for the rest of my miserable life. fucken hell.

(75 cl)  Une énorme tête blanche flotte éternellement sur un liquide à la robe orangée.  Une large dentelle sinstalle avec timidité.  Le nez, qui est complexe et doux, contient des notes fruitées surettes et des parfums boisés agréablement touchés par une levure sauvageonne.  Des saveurs franches et mordantes de pamplemousse, de citron, de pomme verte et de raisins blancs y sont intelligemment bercées par des notes dune belle aigreur.  Une bouche orgasmique, un corps suave, une texture douce, des bulles appropriées et régulières.  Une finale fortement fruitée, justement intense et persistante.  Une fantastique gueuze, facile à boire, peut-être un peu trop  Vivement une autre bouteille.
Bottle. Pours a murky yellow color with a black type sediment. Suspended. Aroma is absolutely tart, funky and lambic-like. Smells farmhouse. Flavor is sour and tart with a fruity note. Nice.
Bottle. Aroma gueuze classic sour.  High carbonation. A high end gueuze classic. Not Bad.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2011 Drank this one as desert after our Thanksgiving meal.
A - Pours hazy orange with a small film of white head leaving no lace at all down the glass. This one appears to be dead in my glass...
S - Smells of lots of fruit; mostly lemon and green apples; light funk, and some acidic notes. It gets a little vinous toward the end of each sniff as it warms up.
T - Starts off with a nice sized dose of tartness quickly giving way to a mix of green apples, lemons, dry oak, and the ever present light funk. The mix of funk/tart to fruit is really nice. It wasnt as funky or tart as I was expecting going into it but I think this one was still pretty fresh. I would love to give an aged bottle a try one day.
M - Medium body and flavor with moderately low carbonation. Even tho this one was a little light on the carb I still enjoyed the light, funky, feel this one offered.
O - I am learning to love this style and this is one of the better examples. It has a very nice fruity character and the funk isnt overpowering. Awesome stuff.
Extremely drinkable Gueuze.  Great bitterness mellowed by some oaked undertones.  Top-class

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2016 750ml Aged bottle from a trade with Edo. A huge gusher ! Haze amber/golden color, medium white head that vanishes quickly. Aroma of sour fruits, yeast, wet wood, balsamico. The taste is similar as described i nthe aromas, to sour for my untrained palate in the beginning but qutie enjoyable after a while. Nice dry finish.

RE-Rate as a turned-Lambic lover. Wonderful orange color, citrus note, mostly grapefruit, wet wood notes, nice sournes. Well rounded taste, very dry, thoroughly enjoyable.

37.5 cL bottle from ABS Drinks in Winksele poured into a Westmalle glass at home.  Amber fizzy beer with a nice but short lived head.  The aroma is a nice lambic one, lightly acidic and a hopped.  A bit sour, but quite mild and palatable, acidic but tasty.
(Bottle 25/10-2011) Low white head, slightly unclear yellow color, sweet slightly sour fruit aroma, medium dry sour taste. Rather balanced.
"Murky" color and extremely "beer" taste.  Not my favorite, but it has some qualities which I see how others can appreciate.

Thanks to Hopshunter for the share.  Pours a murky yellow with a white head.  Nose is lemon, citrus, funk, bugs, vinegar, and a lot of acetic/ tartness.  Flavor is similar with vinegar, tartness, and citrus all over.  Mouth-puckeringly sour gueuze.  Light to medium in body and very gueuze-y.

REF C x 2010 - cork

A - a loud pop gives way to a clear golden gueuze with a huge champagne head that recedes to a sheet that lingers forever.

S - lemon, green apples, and lots of wet horsblanket funk with a little bit of bandaid.

T - Bright and sour, acetic and acidic. A good amount of leather and horseblanket once it reaches room temperature. Leather, green apples, white grapes, lemons, and hay.

M/D - creamy texture and dry. I could drink it everyday.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2012 Bottle @ Ørsted Ølbar on October 14. Pours hazy golden brown with a thick white head. Smell is hay, sourdough, stable, lemon and green apples. Taste is very sour and dry with hay and green apples. Bitterness is slight but its clear its there. Finish is dry and sour. Very nice!Re-rate! Bottle courtesy of rlgk. A great solid geuze with all you want. Definitely raising the rating on the one. Great citrusy smell supported by a mouth puckering lemony taste and a smooth mouthfeel.
a very interesting fermentation. slight bitter fruitiness which did not come from hops rather than byproducts. aroma profile is huge , apple, grapefruit plums.
En botella.Dorada amarillenta.limpia.Afrutada,acida y refrescante.Una cerveza solida.Muy buen aperitivo.
An easy accessable geuze which will not differ alot from bottle to bottle as for example a 3 fonteinen does. Not as sour as 3F and Cantillon, its a bit like the geuze from Tilquin.
This is bettre than the white label, the balance of the sourness is much better. Floral smell, smoky, a bit of the salted water. There is a bit of bitterness/tartness but not to much. Just right !

Bottle @Home. Pours orange golden with a white head. Aroma of tart cherries, green apples, hay, barn, light peppery / spicy notes. Taste is tart fruit, sourness, vinegar, green apples, barn, hay, notes of mold, pepper, earth. Light body, lively carbonation, dry finish. 190911

Bottle.  Pours a clear amber with a moderate sized bubbly foamy off-white head.  Aroma is complex, somewhat champagne-like but with a sweeter fruitier character.  Very full flavored, dry, quite tart.   Highly carbonated, actively bubbling in the mouth, somewhat thin feel.

Taste follows and is the perfect level of tartness. Really just an incredibly easy drinker with unbelievable flavor. 
Probely the best payable gueuze in the world

From the bottle. Poured golden with the tiniest residual head. The aroma brings to mind a farm. The difference between the aroma and taste on this one was huge. Taste started mild but finished deliciously sour (some sips more so than others).

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2012 Bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours a light golden colour with a decent beige head. Nice sour lambic aroma of lemon, musty horse-blanket, pepper and wet cardboard. Flavours of sour lemon, barley, balsamic vinegar. Mouth watering sour finish, little foamy mouth-feel. Lovely! Also had this on draught at De Cam Volkscafe. Pours a dark golden colour with a decent white head. Aroma of lemon, horse blanket, wet cardboard and grassy hops. Similar flavours and fairly tart with a great bitter finish. Mild carbonation and CO2 prickle with a foamy mouth-feel. A definite stand out gueuze (8,3,8,5,18).
Bottled. pours a nice hazy yellow, looks like a typical gueuze. the taste is very sour and its not too sour, it is very drinkable and it is quite enjoyable. Really good offering.
Same bottle as pictured. Poured hazy golden yellow with little head that retained. Nice light tartness mixed with a light malt base and sour finish. Very nice.

Botella de 3/4 servida en copa Flauta.Saboreada en mar´11.
Brota con color cobre y matices de lígero dorado.Velada.Corona espumosa de burbuja media y 0,5cm de espesor ,sin persistencia.Espuma de color blanco amarillento.Aromas de tierra y césped húmedos en nariz redondeados con trazos de manzana ácida y cítricos.En boca sensación tartárica seca no punzante pero chispeante.Los cítricos atacan en el retrogusto liberando un suave sabor agrio.Carbónico bien equilibrado.No tan refrescante como se esperaba aunque el cuerpo lígero la hace muy asimilable.750ml bottle served in a Flute glass.Enjoyed on mar´11.
Pours light golden copper in color.Foggy.Fading,medium bubble, 0,5cm frothy head.Foam is yellowish white in color.Wet earth & wet grass aromas on nose,rounded by granny smith apple & citric hues.Dry tartar mouthfeel not crispy but vivant.Citrics attack on the aftertaste while leaving such an smooth sour taste.Carbonic is well balanced.Not founded as refreshing as expected but ligth body makes it very drinkable.

OK, finally putting down some notes on this beer. Im sure I must have had it well off in the past. Hmm. Pours hazy deep gold with thin off white head. The aroma is fruity and tart with pleasing stale funky dry moldy citrus rind that really pulls it together. The taste is similar with tartness and acidity that struggle to take over the flavor but smooth bold yummy moldy citrus funky earthiness will not give in. Im not a fan of over tart acidic crushed aspirin beer but when theres a good deal of mold, funk, body odor, wet horse hair and the like then Im happy. This refreshing beer makes me happy.
Very nice gueuze with no offensive odours or flavours whatsoever. Very refreshing.
Amber colour, white head. Strong acidic aroma with some fruits, vinegar, wood and strong sour notes. Really strong sour taste with lemon and apple, a little unbalanced, but great nonetheless.
Bottle.  Pours a cloudy golden colour with a foamy white head.  Aroma is tart green apple.  Flavor is nice and lively with a good bit of sourness.  Dry mouthfeel.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2011 37,5 cl Bottle, July 2011,  Vintage from 1999.

This old beauty came from the dusty cellars of Akkurat and it was actually my first beer being over 10 years old. It pours lustrously golden clear with a tinge of orange. The nose is incredibly rich, a fountain of flavours and aromas, full of sugar and complex sour notes. Its so vividly alive and luscious! The aroma is filled with fruits, nuts, wood and of course a dash of barnyard, but not to much.

As I go into tasting it Im surprised how balanced and smooth it is. The levelling of sweet, sour and acidic flavours is simply amazing. At the same time it feels dusty and rustic which I expect from an older beer like this. Great taste with a nice fruitiness here as well. Apples and pears are dominant but just as in the aroma its a jumble of fruits and flavours. The finish is slightly dry and sits just perfect on my tongue. Its so drinkable and if you dont control yourself you quaff it to quick and wonder where the bottle went!

8 - 5 - 9 - 5 - 19


37,5 cl Bottle, August 2011,  Bottle from 2011.
Pours hazy orange. Nose is a bit sharp with a lot of vinegar notes. Under the layer of acidity fruity and flowery flavours is to be found mostly apples and apple tart. There is a nice sourness and barnyard feeling to it but its not anywhere near the vintage mentioned above. It also lacks the sweet aromas that ties everything together and balances it up.

The taste of it is nowhere as balanced as I expected it, still al right though. The barnyard feeling here is much more present and it lacks the sweetness I would have wanted. Dont get me wrong its still very good it just lacks the balance to make it perfect. Hopefully that will come in a few years. Its quite dry and the body medium to full. This is overall a good beer even unaged and seeing thats so cheap this is defiantly a beer you can afford to have home or age in a greater number. Great work.

7 - 4 - 7 - 3 - 17
Lots of apple maps, elderberry and finish is like a white wine vinegar. Its not very balanced, but Ive heard this beer ages really good. Lets see how it is after 5 years.

DAY 1 NOTES:  Bouquet:  Sour, musty, lightly funky (in a fecal family resemblance kind of way) farmhouse, dusty straw, citrus.
Palate: Smoother than the Cantillon fruit lambics. Long finish.
Flavor:  Sour, bitter, moldy/musty, white grapefruit plus rind, plus orange with rind and possibly some dried peach or nectarine.

DAY 2 NOTES:  Bouquet:  Sour, dusty straw, elegant and pleasantly funky farmhouse (more integrated and not fecal), spicy and peppery mikan.  Flavor: Partially dried mikan, with understated sourness, white grapefruit and rind, pepper, dusty straw.  Finishes with a light, funky mold.

COMMENT:  Improved overnight (used champagne stopper).  Brilliant, complex, long finish and superbly balanced.  As the Rate Beer description says, this beats champagne in terms of complexity.  This is the highest rating I have ever given to a beer (or wine!).  As a blend of old and new lambic, the sourness is far less overt than a young lambic, making this smoother and easier to drink.
